message:
Prepare a sumptuous feast this coming Hari Raya! In this clip, Chef Ismail will demonstrate how to cook Rendang Chicken from scratch. For more recipes fit for a brilliant celebration, simply join our "That's My Favourite Lampu Lap-Lip" contest! Along with $100 FairPrice Gift Vouchers and autographed cookbooks, you can win the exclusive Selera Raya DVD in which you can find more clips of Chef Ismail preparing a splendid array of dishes.

Check out the Contest tab on the page to find out more.
Selamat Hari Raya! Take part in our new "Favourite Lampu Lap-Lip" contest where you get to win brilliant festive prizes. Click on the "Contest" tab to find out more!

Chef Ismail's Rendang Chicken. 
Other exciting recipes to follow as we move closer to Hari Raya Puasa celebrations. For a chance to win more such recipes and gift vouchers, participate in our 'That's My Favourite Lampu Lap-Lip' Contest and win autographed cookbooks and DVDs featuring Chef Ismail's culinary wonders! 
Yet another reason to add spice to this festive season!
story: NTUC FairPrice added a new photo to the album: Chef Ismail's Hari Raya Recipes.

message:
Ginger Crunchy Cookies 
Fancy some home-made Ginger Cookies to relish with your family over the long, festive weekend? 
Chef Ismail is sharing his special recipe with all FairPrice fans here. Remember, you can stand to win a lot more exciting recipes from the master chef himself by being part of the 'That's my Favourite Lampu Lap-Lip' Contest. Check Contest Tab for more details!

message:
FairPrice wishes all our Muslim customers a Selamat Hari Raya
Aidilfitri! Here's to joy, happiness and warmth for you and your family!

Coffee Flower Cookies.
Chef Ismail presents mouth-watering 'Coffee Cookies' recipe for you and your loved ones. To stand a chance to win more of many such tempting recipes and FairPrice vouchers, participate in our ongoing 'That's My Favourite Lampu Lap-Lip' contest while the festivities are at the peak!
story: NTUC FairPrice added a new photo to the album: Chef Ismail's Hari Raya Recipes.

message: 'That's my Favourite Lampu Lap-Lip' contest has only 10 more days to go! There are $100 NTUC FairPrice Gift Vouchers, cookbooks and DVDs up for grabs. Simply post a photo/video of your favourite Lampu Lap-Lip along with an interesting caption, tag your friends and get them to 'Like' it. Hurry, check the 'Contest' tab for details now!

Fish Tomato Rice 
Delight in yet another scrumptious dish that you can prepare on your own. Here is Chef Ismail's recipe for the simply delicious dish of Fish Tomato Rice. Prepare it for a family feast! In the meantime, take pictures of some Lampu Lap-Lips to enter our ongoing contest and win great prizes, to make your celebrations even sweeter.

message:

Who can resist the temptation of chocolate molten lava? Now you can easily prepare it at home by following these simple instructions above! Do you know that whole-grains slow the digestive process in your body, keeping you feeling full for longer and thus helps you maintain a healthy weight? On top of that, whole-grains are rich with antioxidants and other essential vitamins which help to fight diseases. This October, in collaboration with HPB, we<U+2019>ve lined up scrumptious cooking demonstrations featuring tasty whole-grain goodies. So join us at FairPrice AMK Hub (B2) & FairPrice Finest Thomson Plaza on 3, 4, 10 & 11 Oct from 11.40am-12noon and 1pm-1.40pm and learn how to prepare wholesome meals for your family!

You can now Shop, Drop and Pump in one go!
A tie-up between NTUC Fairprice,
DHL and Exxon Mobil means you can now shop for groceries, drop off your packages for mailing and pump gas, at petrol stations located across
the island.

message:
An Opportunity To Reach Out And Offer Relief To Disaster Victims

We are all saddened by the loss of lives and destruction caused by the recent disasters. As a social enterprise committed to helping others in need, FairPrice is partnering Singapore Red Cross to raise funds for the Philippines Tropical Storm Appeal and the Padang (Sumatra) Earthquake Appeal. To kick-start the donation drive, FairPrice will be giving $20,000 towards this cause. You can also extend a helping hand to our friends overseas by making a donation through boxes at over 230 FairPrice outlets island wide, including Cheers and FairPrice Xpress from tomorrow onwards. Together, we can provide much needed aid to rebuild the lives of disaster victims.

This October, eat healthy and learn how to prepare a delicious meal of Sliced Fish With Bee Hoon Soup using nutritious whole-grain products! Simply click here to watch cooking demonstrations put together by the Health Promotion Board and remember to share them with your friends!

http://www.hpb.gov.sg/digitools/channelvitem.aspx?id=6402

That's My FairPrice started its journey on Facebook in July 2009 and has since then grown tremendously with all your love and support. We now have a family of more than 26,330 fans where each one of you counts. Thank you all! 
We value your thoughts, suggestions and feedback, and therefore, invite you to spend a few minutes of your time in completing a short survey for us. The questionnaire especially designed for our fans on Facebook will take less than a minute to answer. You can access it at http://fairprice201003.questionpro.com
We really hope you will use this platform to help us get to know you better. 
In the meanwhile, watch this space for more exciting stuff coming up!

International Women's Day, marked on 8th March is to celebrate the economic, political and social achievements  of women  past, present and future. NTUC FairPrice wishes all its female customers a very Happy Women's Day!

200 fans have already checked out our short survey! Thank you all for the time. 
This is a call-out to the rest of FairPrice fans on Facebook to join in! Please click on the link below in order to complete the survey. 
This short questionnaire is prepared especially for our Facebook fans and will only take a minute of your time but will go a long way for us to understand and serve you better. Cheers!

Thank you for
the amazing support with the survey so far. We only need another 100
responses to meet our target, so this will be the last reminder for all
those who have yet to fill out the survey. Your participation will be
much appreciated and will go a long way in helping us understand you
better. Have a good weekend everyone!

Are you missing out
on the latest great deals from us? You<U+2019>ll always be updated on the best

Simply visit www.fairprice.com.sg and click on <U+201C>Latest Ads and Lucky Draw<U+201D> now!

We<U+2019>re 9 days away from Earth Hour. This hour in the dark has become a global sustainability movement, where we all make our stand against climate change.
Look out for our update tomorrow to see what we<U+2019>ve got planned for Earth Hour.

In support of Earth Hour, FairPrice pledges to donate $10,000 towards conservation. Help us turn out the lights
 on our website at http://earthhour.thatsmyfairprice.com.sg
 . Each switch-off equals a dollar so do drop by to help us reach 
our target by 27 March 2010!

Here<U+2019>s a tip for Earth Hour and beyond: Switch  to compact fluorescent lightbulbs. They use 80% less electricity and  last 10 times longer.  Support Earth Hour by turning out the lights at http://earthhour.thatsmyfairprice.com.sg  and we<U+2019>ll donate $10,000 towards conservation.

We are almost reaching 1,000 switch offs and our target is to reach 10,000 by Saturday, 27 March before Earth Hour in order to raise $10,000 for conservation.
Earth needs you! Please help to spread the word by sharing this post/link with your friends and family. It only takes a click from each of us and every switch off counts! Thank you all for your support so far!

Here<U+2019>s a tip for Earth Hour and beyond: 
The electricity used by an air-conditioner is equivalent to the energy 
used by 13 fans! Turn off the AC and turn on your fan instead to keep 
cool!

Last night, an inconsiderate fan hacked our Earth Hour page and switched off on everyone's behalf, denying others the chance to play their part for this cause. This made us reach our $10,000 limit within a few hours last night, which is not fair to the spirit of this campaign. 
FairPrice appeals to all its fans on Facebook to make this into a fair, inclusive community effort where maximum people get to play their part in pledging support and spreading awareness on Earth Hour. We have already removed all but one click from the specific source, so please go ahead and switch off for planet earth at http://earthhour.thatsmyfairprice.com.sg 
Also, please share this with all your friends and family via Facebook, Twitter, Messengers and other platforms. Let us make this work, together!

6930
people have switched off lights on our page to show support for Earth
Hour. We need 3070 more flicks by Saturday in order to raise $10,000
for Earth conservation. Join in, Earth needs your help! Support Earth Hour by turning out the lights at http://earthhour.thatsmyfairprice.com.sg
Here<U+2019>s a tip for Earth Hour and beyond: Consider buying a laptop for your next home computer upgrade as they use less than half the energy used by desktop computers.

Hi
All, we only need less than 400 clicks in order to meet our goal
of $10,000 for Earth Conservation. Thank you all for the
overwhelming support so far in sharing this with all your friends around
the world.The countdown to the 10,000th click has begun!

Thank
you to all FairPrice fans for helping us 
raise $10,000 and spreading awareness on Earth Hour. We reached our target sum with
3 days to spare and we congratulate all those who have been a part of the campaign.
The money raised will be donated to WWF for their earth conservation efforts. 



Earth Hour is this Saturday between 8:30 pm to 9:30 pm and we hope you will
participate with your friends 
and family. FairPrice will also play its part by switching off all
non-essential 
store lights and all office and signage lights. Do share with us your
experience 
of Earth Hour through videos, photos or comments! 



For more information on Earth Hour, please visit 
www.earthhour.org 
Once again, planet Earth thanks you for your support!

Tomorrow is Earth Hour! Support our planet by switching off lights between 8:30 pm to 9:30 pm. Don't forget to share with us your experiences as Comments, Pictures or Videos on this page. Remember, Earth needs us!
Hi Ethan you can refer to this for details on your request. Hope this suffices and good luck!

For the full ad with further details, please visit
http://www.whatsupatfairprice.com.sg

Due to the overwhelming response to 'That's My FairPrice Family' hunt, the  contest is now closed and we will now review all the submitted pictures so far.  Thank you all for your support! The short-listed submissions will be contacted  through their Facebook inbox by Friday. In the meantime, do participate in our  G'Day Australia campaign that gives you a chance to win a $200 hamper of Aussie  products. Good Luck!

FairPrice Cares!  In support of Earth Day, FairPrice has launched 2 initiatives from 22 April to 9 May 2010 where you help the planet and we will help those in need! 
1. Buy a  FairPrice reusable bag and  FairPrice Foundation will match all sale proceeds and donate it to charity. 
2. For every can or PET bottle recycled at our City Square, Marine Parade and AMK Hub stores, $1 will be donated to charity by FairPrice Foundation. 

The total donations are capped at S$60,000. Our appointed charities are AIN Society, Bizlink Centre and Rainbow Centre. 
Play your part in conserving our Earth together with NTUC FairPrice today!

Rachelle Lee and Thomas Teo took their wedding photos at Jurong Point's FairPrice Xtra recently. The two considered the supermarket their "special place", as they often shopped there while they were courting. (source: My Paper 14th April 2010)

Do you have any special memories of FairPrice with your loved ones? We would love to hear your experiences. Feel free to share your stories with everyone here!

Thank you all for the overwhelming response to That<U+2019>s My FairPrice Family Hunt. 
After rounds of short-listing and telephone interviews, we are proud to announce the winning family who walks away with $200 worth of FairPrice vouchers and a spot on the cover of FairPrice<U+2019>s Annual Report FY09/10. 
Imelda, congratulations and we will be contacting you shortly! 
Once again, thank you all for your participation. We 
look forward to your continued support!

It is our 37th Anniversary and we invite you to join in as we celebrate with a series of fun filled events lined up for you at FairPrice stores at Bedok Interchange and City Square Mall!! 
There will be quizzes, lucky dips with exciting prizes and cake (yum!) cutting for all FairPrice fans who join in the festivities!
So mark your diaries, 10am to 2pm at Bedok Interchange store and 12noon to 4pm at City Square mall. Spread the word and be there!!

Thank you to all those who turned up on Saturday for our 37th Anniversary celebrations! Your support means a lot to us. Here is a snap from the cake cutting ceremony at City Square store! 
Cheers!
story: NTUC FairPrice with Julia Ng and 2 others.

message: You will be pleased to know that 3 of our stores around Singapore (Buona Vista CC, Woodlands 88 and Siglap) have been converted to 24 hour operations recently. We hope this benefits many of you here. Feel free to share your thoughts!

Thanks to everyone's help, we managed to reach a grand total of $53,332.80 through the "FairPrice Cares!" campaign! Over 25,000 reusable grocery bags were bought, and nearly 30,000 bottles and cans recycled at the three FairPrice stores during this period.

We tried our best but still didn't meet our target of $60,000. 
But to thank the charities for their support, we've decided to still donate $60,000 equally to the 3 supported charities for this programme - AIN Society, Rainbow Centre and Bizlink Centre. 

Thanks again for all the effort and support everyone! Every action counts!

YOUths can pick up LinkPoints @ all 
FairPrice outlets with nEbO Card! Earn 2 Linkpoints with every $1 
spent. 
Not a nEbO member yet? 
Check it out @ http://www.nebo.sg/site/TheNeboCard.aspx

Calling out all FairPrice friends, to be part of something exciting, useful and uniquely Singaporean! 
Do you have trouble matching wines with local food? 
Post names of dishes you would like to pair wine with- and our forthcoming, first-of-its-kind application will help you match the food of your choice with the most suitable wine. 
So what are you waiting for? Bring on the suggestions!

Hey everyone, LinkPoints app is here for your iPhones! Now you can not only view your LinkPoints balance, but search for nearby participating merchants, check latest rewards & promotions and win instant LinkPoints on the go! 

Download this free application from iTunes today!

A gentle reminder to all FairPrice friends: Come be part of building an
exciting and unique Wine Application which will help you match local
dishes with wine! 
Post names of dishes you would like to pair a wine with- and we will feature the dish along with the matching wine in our app.  
Hurry! This is your chance to be involved in uniquely Singaporean experience with FairPrice.

DID YOU KNOW: You can now check out (and even download!) all the latest offers and deals from FairPrice. 
www.whatsupatfairprice.com.sg - one stop where you get access to latest FairPrice promotions, lucky draw results, recipes, tips and other highlights on the go! 
Do pass the link around to your friends and family who would find this useful too!

FairPrice Xtra's Xtravaganza Sale starts tomorrow! 
There will be special Roadshows the next three Saturdays at FairPrice Xtra Jurong Point on June 12, Hougang Point on June 19 and AMK Hub on June 26. Look out for the one closest to you!

The hunt for Singapore<U+2019>s greatest family of cooks has just begun. 
The <U+2018>FairPrice Family Cook Off' <U+2013> an exciting new reality cooking show is coming soon to Channel 8! Auditions are about to start, so if you and family are passionate about cooking together, this is just the platform for you to showcase your talent! 
To find out more about the show and register to be on it, click on the link below

Join us in our eco-conservation efforts. 100 Tickets for 'The Age of Stupid' are up for grabs! 
Refer to the banner below for details!
The New Paper Big Walk is back! Please see link for details.

Auditions for The FairPrice Family Cook Off TV show have already begun! Even though the show is being launched on Channel 8, The Participants NEED NOT Be Mandarin Speaking. 
  

We are looking to reflect Singapore's diversity on the show and we welcome participation from both Singaporeans and Permanent Residents alike, language is no barrier. The idea is to find the family of greatest cooks in Singapore, so if you think you are up for the challenge and loads of fun, sign up today! Hurry, limited seats left!

Good news! Our Khatib store has also been converted to 24 hour operations yesterday.
Address: Blk 849, Yishun Ring Road, #01-3701/3073 SINGAPORE 760849

If you are a resident of a nearby neighborhood, we are keen to hear your thoughts, do share! Cheers!

FairPrice Family Cook Off has its very own Facebook page! Join in now to find out more about the reality show that searches for Singapore's greatest family of cooks! Auditions have already begun, click on the link below to find out more.

FairPrice Family Cook Off- the deadline for registration has been extended to 7 July! 
Check out the video of an interview with the show's creator, Damien Bray on 938LIVE and sign up for the show with your family today at www.cookoff.com.sg 
The winning family walks away with an all expenses paid trip to Tasmania including lessons at a gourmet cooking school!!

Bringing you the snippets of recently concluded Xtravaganza Sale, with exciting roadshows conducted over the last three weekends at Jurong Point, Hougang Point and AMK Hub. 

If you were a part of all this fun that we see in the pictures, do share your experience with all!

Stay tuned as we bring you more fun and offers at FairPrice Xtra!
story: NTUC FairPrice added 18 new photos to the album: FairPrice Xtra's Xtravaganza Sale.

message:
Hi all, 
Another of our stores has been converted to 24 hour operations yesterday and that is FairPrice at Lorong Limau!
Address: Blk 80 Lorong Limau Road, #01-191 Singapore 320080

Feel free to share your thoughts as always! We look forward to hearing from you, especially those from the affected neighbourhood!

Tomorrow, 7 July is the last 
day for receiving entries for the FairPrice Family CookOff.
This is your chance 
to showcase your talent on Channel 8's forthcoming show as Singapore's 
greatest family of cooks. You and your family could win yourselves an all 
expenses paid trip to Tasmania including lessons from a premier 
gourmet cooking school! Visit www.cookoff.com.sg 
to sign up today!

The New Paper Big Walk is this Sunday at Marina Bay and it pays to be wacky at the walk!!

Did you know: The Big Walk is a lot about having fun and we plan to reward those who have plenty of it! (of course there are also goodie bags for everyone!) 
The dress code <U+2013> at least for those keen on going the extra mile for fun <U+2013> is Mother Earth.
The participant with the most creative costume on the <U+201C>Mother Earth<U+201D>
theme stands to walk away with over $1,000 worth of NTUC FairPrice
vouchers.
This means that your costumes must be either environmentally
friendly or made of recycled materials. More details and T&Cs on http://www.newpaperbigwalk.sg/

Are you game?

Thank you for the great show of support at the Big Walk on Sunday! 
While we work on sharing some exciting photos from the walk with you, we would love to hear from you about your experiences! 
So if you have any photos, videos or interesting anecdotes to share, please do so on the wall here! We hope you had a great time at the walk with your friends and family. Looking forward to hearing from you all!

Hi All, 
Get updates on the latest products, offers, activities and tips emailed directly to you from the FairPrice grapevine. 
You'll also receive useful tips on wines, organic produce, healthy eating, and even recipes for scrumptious meals! 

Simply visit the link below to sign up, and you'll never miss out on what's up at FairPrice!
http://www.whatsupatfairprice.com.sg/Newsletter_signup.aspx
Can you spot yourself in the album?
story: NTUC FairPrice added 50 new photos to the album: The New Paper Big Walk 2010.

message:
Tomorrow marks the 1st anniversary of 'That's My FairPrice' page on Facebook!
In the last one year we have had a lot of fun interacting with you all on this platform and growing up to a 28600 strong community on Facebook. Thank you for being there with us on this journey with 
your compliments, feedback and participation. We have constantly striven to address all your queries through this medium while spicing it up with many exciting contests and campaigns for Christmas, Chinese New Year, Earth Hour etc. 


We would like to hear from you, your thoughts on having FairPrice around you on Facebook. What did you enjoy the most in the last one year we have been with you here? Please do let us know here!

To mark FairPrice Family Cook Off's first filming session at sentosa, we invite everyone for a Family Fun Weekend on 7 and 8 August at Palwan Beach, Sentosa!

Visit the FairPrice stand with the kids for some face painting and games, or some fun arts and crafts at the Lam Soon stand, or check out PERFECT ITALIANO's leaning tower of cheese for your chance to win a year<U+2019>s supply! And the kids are sure to love the SIS Sugar cupcake decorating competition. Or you can bake life sweeter with some free goodies from the Betty Crocker range.

For more information, visit http://www.cookoff.com.sg
Come cheer for Team Singapore at *Scape Youth Park with us tomorrow, 3 Aug (Tues) 4-6pm!
FairPrice wishes everyone a fantastic National Day! Happy 45th Birthday Singapore! Cheers!

FairPrice Finest Festival (12 Aug- 8 Sept 2010) 
Come down tomorrow, 14 August to FairPrice Finest at Triple One Somerset and enjoy free sampling of fruits, deli, beer and wine. What's more, we are also going to give away free ice-cream from 3 pm onwards (while stocks last!).

There are also going to be many more fun filled activities like Button Badge-Making, Silhouette Paper Cutting, Caricature Drawing and Balloon Sculpting over the period of 4 weeks! Refer to the attached poster for details! We hope to see you there!
Go Team Singapore! Like this post to show your support for Team Singapore at YOG along with FairPrice. Three cheers for all our young athletes!

Hi all, as you all know, the Finest Festival is currently on at FairPrice Finest! Last Saturday at Finest TripleOne Somerset, we had a host of activities including food, beer and wine sampling along with other exciting stuff! Here are some of the snippets of all the action that took place!

Remember to visit us at Finest during our Finest Festival!
story: NTUC FairPrice added 28 new photos to the album: Finest Festival 14th Aug 2010.

message:
Welcome to our brand new FairPrice Xpress at Esso station on AMK Ave 8! 
Now you can fill your tanks and your shopping baskets at the same time- 24 hours a day, Monday to Sunday.

Over 80 children came together to show their love for their country by designing hand-made birthday cards for Singapore. We are proud to announce the top 3 entries that walk away with $50 vouchers each. Please join us in congratulating the winners!
Need to energize yourself with a fresh banana on your way back from the morning jog? Hop over to the FairPrice Xpress nearby, fresh fruits and vegetables available 24 hours a day, everyday!

Its time!
Remember how over the past few months, we have been asking you to suggest local dishes that you would like to match wine with? We heard you all, and proudly present to you the FairPrice Wine Finder! 

If at times you wondered what wine pairs best with Char Kway Teow, Chilli Crab or Chicken Rice, this is your answer! Try our uniquely Singaporean- FairPrice Wine Finder to find out wine pairings for your local makan favorites!

Check out the 'Wine Finder' tab on our wall!
FairPrice wishes its customers Selamat Hari Raya Aidilfitri! Have a wonderful time with family and friends!

Lunch hour rush? Pick up a Delicous Beef Lasagne and some Polar puffs at your nearest FairPrice Xpress! 
Tasty, Time-Saving Treats and much more, available round the clock.

Collect exclusive Sola Swiss Kitchen Knives with your bonus points from 16th Sep to 24th Nov 2010. 1 Bonus Point = $30 in a single receipt. 

What's more, you can start redeeming your knives with only 6 bonus points, plus top it up with a bit of cash or your LinkPoints. Hurry, grab these great deals, while stocks last! 
For more details, refer to the attached picture.

Join us for the Grand Opening of FairPrice Xpress at Esso Station along Ang Mo Kio Avenue 8 on Saturday 2 Oct from 9 am onwards and receive a free goodie bag! 

Drive in or drop by for all your essential needs, 24 hours a day, 7 days a week!
We are extremely pleased to have reached 30,000 members on our Facebook page last night! A big thanks to all of you for your love, support, encouragement and feedback. Cheers!

Hi everyone, what was your weekend like? Did you spend it with your loved ones? We would love to hear from you! Click the <U+2018>Signup Form<U+2019> tab at the top to take our short poll, and share with us how you spend quality time with your family!

Want to receive the latest buzz on the FairPrice grapevine? Sign up for our monthly e-newsletter today and get access to content on Healthy Eating, Fresh Produce, Wine, latest FairPrice products and more! Sign up today at http://bit.ly/cp6jfQ

Hi Everyone!
We have a new FairPrice outlet in Kim Tian which opens today! It's located at 18/20 Kim Tian Road, #01-640 and opens between 8am and 10pm daily. Do drop by today and check out the in-store specials!

Thank you for your support towards FairPrice Buzz! We had an overwhelming number of sign-ups through the NTUC Lifestyle magazine recently. We will contact the first 100 respondents soon on their vouchers. Watch this space!
Get The FairPrice Buzz

Hi Everyone! Have you already told us about your favorite family bonding activities? If you haven't, click on the 'Signup Form' tab at the top of this page! And a big Thank You to those who have responded!
NTUC FairPrice Walk for Rice @ South East back for the second year

Hi Everyone!
Are you ready for the biggest culinary battle Singapore has ever seen? The moment you have all been waiting for is finally arriving tomorrow at 8 pm on MediaCorp Channel 8!

Who is Singapore's best family of cooks? To find out, watch the FairPrice Family Cook Off every Friday, 8pm - 8.30pm, on MediaCorp Channel 8! And there's also fantastic prizes to be won in our Cook, Vote and Win contest!  For more details, visit www.cookoff.com.sg

Hi everyone!
Thank you to our Lifestyle magazine readers who have signed up for FairPrice Buzz! The first 100 subscribers have won themselves a $20 FairPrice gift voucher. Please check your inbox to see if you're one of the lucky winners, as well as details for collection!

The heat is on, and the FairPrice Cook Off is off to a great start! 8 families are cooking up a storm, and battling it out to be Singapore's best family of cooks! Did you catch the launch episode last Friday night on Mediacorp Channel 8? If you missed it or would like to watch it again, you can do so here http://bit.ly/c0isHF.
Let us know you think about the show!

Hi Everyone!
Episode 2 of the FairPrice Familly Cook Off will be shown tonight at 8pm on Channel 8. Make sure you catch it as French-Chinese family 'Cotton Bleu' take on four young sisters 'The Cupcakes' for a chance to make it through to the semi-final.
You can also participate in our Cook, Vote and Win contest. Grab our recipe cards at selected FairPrice stores or online and try cooking the recipes yourself. Then vote for your favourite at www.cookoff.com.sg. There are fantastic prizes to be won every week!
Open Your Hearts, Open Their Minds!

Hi Everyone! 
Did you catch the second episode last Friday night on Mediacorp Channel 8? If you missed it or would like to watch it again, you can do so here http://bit.ly/c0isHF. 
Share with us which family you are rooting for!

Hi Everyone! Have you already told us about your favorite family bonding activities? If you haven't, click on the 'Signup Form' tab at the top of this page! And a big Thank You to those who have responded!

Tried any recipes from the FairPrice Family Cook Off? If you haven't, go grab our recipe cards at selected FairPrice stores or online at www.cookoff.com.sg. Have a go at the recipes yourself, and share photos of how your dishes turned out! If you like what you've prepared, go vote for your favourite recipe in our Cook, Vote and Win contest. There are FairPrice shopping vouchers and TOTT homeware vouchers to be won every week!

Don't miss out our 3rd episode of the FairPrice Family Cook Off tonight at 8pm on MediaCorp Channel 8. This week we have The Rojaks and Double Trouble battling it out in the kitchen, cooking some mouth watering dishes!
FairPrice wishes its customers a Happy Deepavali! Have a wonderful time with family and friends!
FairPrice Share-A-Textbook 2010

Have a go at the recipes featured in last week's FairPrice Family Cook Off! Step by step details on how to prepare The Rojak's Seafood Parmesan Roll and Double Trouble's Battling the Fungi rice dish can be found at http://bit.ly/bT1SzI . Be sure to let us know how the dishes turn out!

Remember to catch Episode 4 of the FairPrice Family Cook Off on MediaCorp Channel 8 at 8pm tonight! Gado Gado Gang will go head to head  with The Wan and Only -- which family will cook up more intriguing dishes to win over the judges? Tell us your predictions!
Pen-A-Note Now!
FairPrice wins <U+2013>  everybody else does too!
FairPrice wins- Retail Asia-Pacific Top 500 Awards

Did you know you can watch the FairPrice Family Cook Off on your mobile phone? Just go to www.cookoff.com.sg/mobile and catch up on episodes you've missed! Share with us the family you are rooting for!

Episode 5 of the FairPrice Family Cook Off will be shown tonight at 8pm on MediaCorp Channel 8! Tune in to catch The Curry Cooks battle it out with Chopstick Sisters! You can also join our Cook, Vote and Win contest. Grab our recipe cards at selected FairPrice stores or online and try cooking the recipes yourself. Then vote for your favourite at www.cookoff.com.sg. And you could win fantastic prizes every week!
Now that we are down to 4 semi-finalists -- Gado Gado Gang, The Rojaks, Cotton Bleu, Chopstick Sisters, who do you think will emerge victorious and win the Grand Prize of a trip to Tasmania?
Our Valued Supporting Partners

Don't miss the FairPrice Family Cook Off Semi-Final tonight at 8pm on MediaCorp Channel 8. It<U+2019>s the clash between Cotton Bleu and Gado Gado Gang. Find out which team has what it takes to get in the Final!

Hi Everyone!
We have a new 24 Hours FairPrice outlet in Bishan North which opens today! It's located at BLK 279 BISHAN STREET 24 #01-62/64 Singapore 570279. Do drop by today and check out the in-store specials!

FairPrice wins again, with its consumers! In a recent Superbrands customer research, NTUC FairPrice ranked third, the highest for a home-grown brand. We trailed only Google and Colgate (see article here - http://www.straitstimes.com/BreakingNews/Singapore/Story/STIStory_607150.html). Thank you once again for all your tremendous support. 


Please 'Like' this post to show us your support here too!
Have a Heart, Share a Gift!

We are proud to bring you our newest 24 hour FairPrice Xtra hypermarket at Nex Mall. Come down for a host of opening specials this week - it's next to the Serangoon MRT station! 

Stay tuned for more updates<U+2026>
Public Distribution of Textbooks!

Tried any recipes from the FairPrice Family Cook Off yet? If you haven't, pick up our recipe cards at selected FairPrice stores or online at www.cookoff.com.sg. And have a go at the recipes yourself! If you like what you prepared, go vote for your favourite recipe in our Cook, Vote and Win contest. And you could win NTUC FairPrice Gift Vouchers and TOTT homeware vouchers every week!

Catch our 7th episode of the FairPrice Family Cook Off tonight at 8pm on MediaCorp Channel 8. This week, The Rojaks and Chopstick Sisters battle it out by cooking some mouth-watering dishes using ingredients from New Zealand! Share with us what you think of the show!
Our pirate is at it again at the Electronics section of our new 24 hour FairPrice Xtra in Nex Mall. If you managed to take photos of him, do share with us! We'd love to see them!

Don't miss out our 8th and final episode of the FairPrice Family Cook Off this Friday at 8pm on MediaCorp Channel 8. The Rojaks and Cotton Bleu go head to head in this Christmas Special and whip up some delectable Christmas dishes!
Join us at selected FairPrice stores to make the most of our Back to School Specials from the 9th-29th December 2010! Click on the image for more details!

Join us at our FairPrice Finest outlets and take in the enchanting musical performances by string quartet Luminus Quartet and harpist Magdelene Wong, while enjoying our in-store specials.
There<U+2019>s more reason to be merry, at FairPrice Finest. 
Click on the image for more details!
U Care Back to School Vouchers

Tune in for the Christmas-themed finale of the FairPrice Family Cook Off tonight at 8pm on MediaCorp Channel 8! Get into the mood for Christmas and spread the festive spirit by whipping up the dishes featured for your loved ones. Remember to share your photos and experiences with us here!

Here's another chance to catch our pirate in action... He will be making his final appearance this weekend at our new 24 hour FairPrice Xtra in Nex Mall. 

Drop by today (Saturday) between 12pm-4pm and tomorrow (Sunday) between 12pm-4pm and snap a photo with him (pls share with us!). There are also more activities in-store, so do drop by and say hello.
Congratulations to Cotton Bleu for winning the FairPrice Family Cook Off! And thank you to all for watching! Remember to share photos of dishes you've made and what you think of our show!
The Christmas issue of FairPrice Buzz is out and is packed with jolly Christmas delights! Have you got yours? Sign up at http://bit.ly/cp6jfQ for your own personalized copy!

Did you enjoy the delightful musical performances by string quartet Luminus Quartet and harpist Magdelene Wong over the weekend at our FairPrice Finest outlets? Remember to share photos and what you thought of the performances!
There<U+2019>s more reason to be merry, at FairPrice Finest.
Share with us your photos of the enchanting musical performance by string quartet The Luminus Quartet last weekend, and tell us what you thought of the music!
Send a Season's Greetings card to your friends and family this holiday season.

Get into the Christmas mood at FairPrice Finest this Saturday (18 Dec) as we bring you an enchanting musical performance by harpist Magdalene Wong. 

Performance times:
1pm-2pm at FairPrice Finest, Bukit Timah Plaza
4pm-5pm at FairPrice Finest, Marine Parade
7pm-8pm at FairPrice Finest, TripleOne Somerset

Come join in the spirit of a Finest Christmas and discover the delights we have in store for you. See you there!

Come down to our FairPrice Xtra outlet at Nex this Saturday (18 Dec), 10pm - midnight as we bring you another day of Xtra FUN in store. 

Event highlights include:
- DJ JiaFa from MediaCorp Y.E.S. 93.3FM as Event MC
- Face Painting
- Tarot Card Reading
- Pirate Mascot Meet & Greet
- Balloon Sculpting
- Cannon Ball Game
- All-day Treasure Hunt

There will also be a special guest appearance by Auntie Lucy between 10pm and 10.30pm.

So, do join us this Saturday for Xtra Fun, Xtra Savings, Xtra Variety. See you all there!

Were you serenaded by the sounds of the harpist at our FairPrice Finest stores last Saturday? Our weekend shoppers sure did enjoy themselves. Here are a few photos from the event. If you have more photos to share, please do so. Merry Christmas everyone!

Christmas is just 2 days away. If you haven't send out your Christmas cards, you can use our free Christmas eCard sender. It's quick and easy, and you can personalise your eCard with your favourite photo. This is your chance to show off your family photo to your friends, or that Christmas pudding you just baked! Merry Christmas everyone!
Merry Christmas to our dear shoppers! Trust everyone had a great time getting together with family and friends.

It's Boxing Day! If you are out shopping at FairPrice today, don't forget you can enter our lucky draw. Just spend $30 to qualify and you can choose from one of these 5 fabulous prizes:
- 12D Europe Adventure for two
- 6D Roayl aribbean Cruise for four
- A pair of luxury watches
- $10,000 worth of designer furniture vouchers
- $10,000 worth of NTUC FairPrice Gift vouchers

Hurry, promotion ends on 5 January 2011.

The New Year is just around the corner. Are you planning a New Year's eve party or just planning a quiet stay at home and watch the fireworks? Either way, do check out these fabulous deals at FairPrice for your New Year's eve celebrations - http://bit.ly/ey8tGo

Here's To A Great New Year's Bash!

Our new FairPrice Finest My Village store opens today at Serangoon Garden Village, with operating hours from 8am to 10pm. Do drop by and say hello, while you stock up on some goodies for the New Year.

Happy New Year! We'd like to wish you and your family and friends a Happy and Prosperous 2011!!

Have a great year ahead,
The FairPrice Facebook Team

message: 2011 is finally here!! How did you spend your New Year's?
New year, new resolutions! Will you be taking up a new sport, picking up a new skill or spending more quality time with your loved ones? What are your goals for 2011?
THANK YOU! <U+201C>FairPrice Share-A-Textbook 2010<U+201D> was a huge success!

Help your fellow Singaporeans usher in the Year of the Rabbit by sharing your best spring cleaning tips! Perhaps donating clothes that no longer fit or trading in old books at the second-hand bookstore? Any other suggestions?
<U+62DB><U+8D22><U+8FDB><U+5B9D>, You're Invited to Usher in Prosperity with FairPrice!

Want to know more about the traditions of Chinese New Year, and how to get greater prosperity? Just click on the 'The Prosperity Rabbit' tab above! AND stand to win FairPrice vouchers!

message: Congratulations Ling Fei Chee, Nancy Nl and Soh Yao Rong for being the winners of the first week of The Prosperity Rabbit contest! You have each won for yourselves NTUC FairPrice vouchers and we will contact you soon with more collection details! We hope you had a great time and thank you for your participation!
Got a favourite photo to share with your loved ones? How about sending them a photo e-Card greeting this CNY instead? Click on the 'CNY e-Card' tab above to start sending!

message: CNY is a time for a reunion get-together, whether it's dining out or having a hearty home-cooked meal. What are some of your favourite Chinese New Year dishes? We hope the Year of the Rabbit will bring everyone hopping good luck!
Busy with CNY preparations? Now you can check out FairPrice deals while on the move. Just surf whatsupatfairprice.com.sg on your smart phone and be a smart shopper!

message: Congratulations Shermine Tan, Ching Wen Wang and Lai Zheng Wei for being the winners of the second week of The Prosperity Rabbit contest! The final FairPrice Xtra Hypermarket anniversary celebrations for 2011 was held at Ang Mo Kio Hub B2 on 09 Apr 2011. Many of our customers turned up for the event and could not wait to try the Cash Grab machine! There was a twist to the game this time which saw the emcee, Jia Fa, pick the lucky customers for the Cash Grab machine from a box of receipts instead of a first-come, first-served basis. This gave all customers a fair chance to play! The top winner managed to grab a total of $85 FairPrice vouchers which was quite a feat!

With that, we end off our 2011 FairPrice Xtra Hypermarket anniversary celebrations and we hope to see all of you for future events and celebrations!!

message:
Breaking the Red Wine rule with Seafood <U+2013> Contrary to popular belief, seafood does not always have to be paired with white wine. A group of food bloggers were invited by FairPrice Finest to a hands-on cooking class, where they learnt to prepare simple elegant seafood dishes using premium frozen seafood from FairPrice Finest. After the class, the participants enjoyed their culinary creations paired with fine red wine.

Bloggers Edith (Precious Moments), Terry (Food Canon and Philip (Keropokman) enjoyed a wonderful cooking lesson by Chef Ming. They prepared Quick King Crab and Asparagus Salad and Seared Mahi-mahi with Hollandaise and Sundried Tomato Coulis. Yummy!
story: NTUC FairPrice added 137 new photos to the album: FairPrice Finest- Seafood Culinary Session And Wine Pairing Event.

In a recently conducted Asia's Top 1000 brands report by Campaign and research firm, TNS, NTUC FairPrice has had the honour of being awarded the Top 4th brand in Southeast Asia! A huge thank you goes out to all our supportive fans. Your trust in us is what keeps us striving to continue and deliver on our promise of Quality, Value and Service. You can read more about the report at http://bit.ly/lgYUDX!

FairPrice has launched this year<U+2019>s Well-Wishing Campaign in partnership with the Singapore Sports Council on 29 September 2011. We are contributing a total of S$80,000 to fund this project that will provide a platform for Singaporeans to support our athletes. Singaporeans can deliver their well-wishes to Team Singapore through social media platforms and also at 64 participating FairPrice stores. 
  
We are proud to once again support our athletes by helping to raise awareness, and bring Singaporeans together to root for Team Singapore in the SEA Games.

Brown rice is basically what almost all forms of white rice looks like before it has been put through a refining process. After removing the out-side hull and bran, the rice is lighter and faster to cook. However, most of the health benefits have been lost in the refining process.

We are aware of the comments related to Thern Da Seafood and we know many customers are upset by the insensitive post on their FB page. We take this matter very seriously and are investigating this matter. We will provide an update soon.

Thank you everyone for your comments and for alerting us to this matter. As a standing instruction, all our suppliers are required to clear their joint promotional materials and messages with us before implementation. In this incident, the supplier had not complied with our standing instruction. We take this matter very seriously and we are withdrawing all products from Thern Da Seafood across all our stores. 

Sustainability is important to FairPrice and we have been relooking various policies in our commitment to be a socially responsible retailer. The sale of shark fin has been one of the areas that we have  been looking into in the past few months. We are pleased to announce that we will cease the sale of shark fin products by the first quarter of this year. This is to ensure that we honour our current commitments to our partners but will no longer be placing new orders for shark fin products.

We thank everyone for the overwhelming support on our decision to cease the sale of shark<U+2019>s fin products as our commitment to be a responsible corporate citizen. We assure everyone that by the end of March 2012, all FairPrice stores, including our Cheers and FairPrice Xpress convenience stores, will be Shark<U+2019>s Fin free.

Have a great 2012 everyone!

story: NTUC FairPrice added 8 new photos to the album: Celebrity Chef Eric Teo cooks up a storm at FairPrice.

message:
Dear fans, thank you for the comments. Please keep the discussion going and share pictures of abused trolleys if you come across them.

Through the years, we have implemented several initiatives which include exchanging IDs, and proximity locking systems that lock trolleys beyond a certain area. These methods were not only unable to deter trolleys from going lost, but were also costly and caused additional inconvenience to our shoppers. 

We even conducted a survey to better understand why our trolleys have gone missing. The research found that over 90% of shoppers agreed it is the shoppers responsibility to return trolleys but also cited inconvenience and laziness as top reasons for not returning. 

We hope that through public support, we can encourage others to do the right thing so that we can create an even more pleasant shopping experience for everyone.

story: NTUC FairPrice updated their cover photo.

message:
Dear Fans, allow us a minute of your time to share some thoughts on concerns regarding our recruitment of foreign workers that is being discussed on the online space.

FairPrice<U+2019>s recruitment policy has always been to hire Singaporeans first. Despite the challenges hiring people for the service industry, about 90 percent of our staff are Singaporeans or PRs. Over 80 percent of our total workforce are Singapore citizens. 

As we open more stores to serve our customers better, we also need more staff to fill all the vacancies. Besides advertising these vacancies in local dailies to hire Singaporeans and PRs, we have also worked with various agencies like CDCs, WDS,e2i, various polytechnics and ITEs to name a few. 

Unfortunately, we have not been able to fill all the vacancies and, hence, need to seek alternative manpower resources in neighbouring countries. Thanks and have a great weekend ahead!

message:
On behalf of FairPrice, our CEO, Mr Seah Kian Peng (standing, 3rd from left), is pleased to receive the Singapore Prestige Brand Award 2012 (Heritage Brand), organised by Lianhe Zaobao and the Association of Small and Medium Enterprises.
As a Singapore brand that has grown to be an established household name, this award is a milestone in our journey as we continue to center on our brand promise of delivering quality products at best value and service!

Here are some past years' photos of the FairPrice Share-A-Textbook project. Share your stories and/or photos with us if you had donated textbooks, benefited from the project or volunteered for the project in the past 30 years. We want to hear from you!

FairPrice Share-A-Textbook project turns 30 this year. In the past three decades, many have graciously donated and received textbooks, giving these textbooks a second life while doing their part for the environment. Ms Ginny Chan, one of the many who has benefitted from this project, shares her story: 

"When me & my twin sister, Jenny were studying in upper primary level years ago, we donated & received free 2nd-hand textbooks from the Used Textbooks Project. This continued on till our secondary level.

During those times, we queued up very early in the wee hours of the morning with our father, Mr Chan Kung Leong who was then a taxi-driver with NTUC Comfort, in order to get the textbooks fast. Otherwise, the textbooks would be in a mess & disorganised as they were placed in carton boxes then; unlike nowadays where they're placed neatly on tables.

Though the used textbooks were not new or clean, the advantage of having scribbled notes from previous users were a great help for us to understand the topics better.

However, the best part was that it helped to lighten my parents' burden in our education costs as our family consists of 4 school-going children.

Really nice to know that this project is still ongoing and we know that it'll continue to benefit many other needy families just like how it has benefited us."

Donate your used textbooks from now till 7 Dec. Share to show you care!

Have you heard of Sugarloaf Cabbage? Sugarloaf Cabbage has a pointed head and a softer texture as compared to other varieties of cabbage. Also, Sugarloaf cabbage are remarkably sweeter than common cabbage. Essentially, it can replace any given cabbage in any recipe, it will just offer a sweet flavor, crispier and a more tender texture.Sugarloaf cabbage pairs well with bright citrus flavors, vinegars and vinaigrettes, sausages, pork belly and shoulder, grilled, smoked and fried white fish, apples, melting cheeses and chillies. Remember to refrigerate after purchase!

We are excited! This month, we will be sharing with you facts and tips about fresh fruits. Their characteristics, how to pick the best ones, how to store them and may be some interesting ways to consume them! 'Like' this post if you are excited about this as well!

Have an unripe avocado at home? If you can't wait to savour it, try putting it in a paper bag with apples and bananas to hasten the ripening process! Ripe avocados can last for 1 to 2 days in refrigerator. 

Do take note that the fruit yields to pressure when gently squeezed with palm. Also, avoid picking avocados with dark soft blemishes. Enjoy the nutty, rich flavour and the smooth creamy texture of this healthy fruit!
Saluting the spirit of womanhood, FairPrice would like to wish all its female shoppers and staff a very Happy Women's Day!

When choosing a black plum, make sure you look for one that is well shaped, has good colour and is firm but not hard. Do not worry if the skin has some scarring from the branches as it does not affect the quality of the fruit. 

Ripe plums can be stored for up to 5 days in the refrigerator but keep them away from ethylene producing fruits (Apples, Peaches, Pears etc.) so that they do not become over-ripe.

60,000+ strong Facebook family for FairPrice, which is only growing stronger by the day! Our heartfelt thanks to each one of you for your constant love and support. Please continue to share this page with your friends and family!

Thought that mangoes were all the same? Next time, try looking for the Harumanis Mango originating from Indonesia! Covered in green with a deep yellow coloured flesh, it is a great source of potassium and Vitamin C. Keep them fresh within 15 to 18 degrees to prolong their shelf life.

Always loved the pinkish-red skinned Fuji apple that comes with a sweet and juicy crunch taste? Here are a few tips on selecting your apples:

- Should ideally have 75% or more red skin
- Low level of russeting is acceptable
- Small black pitted spot is acceptable
- Smaller size than other fruits is acceptable

Try to consume within 2 weeks, while storing it in refrigerated conditions.
Happy shopping for Fuji apples!

Always wondering on how to pick the best blueberries? Try looking for those that are firm, dry, plump and smooth-skinned with a silvery surface bloom! Avoid berries that are soft, mouldy, shriveled or have decayed. 
Storage tips:
- Keep refrigerated for a week or two in their original plastic pack or in a covered bowl or container.
- Do not wash until ready to consume 
- You can freeze them for a prolonged shelf life as well!

Did you know that a Gracio Sunrise Papaya actually has a shelf life of 10 to 15 days? The dry/brown tips of the fruit do not reflect the taste of it. In fact, the papaya still tastes good at this stage and has more room for ripening before it fully turns yellow.

Pomegranates have been cherished for their exquisite beauty, flavor, color, and health benefits for centuries! Inside their inedible husk are individual seeds surrounded by a juice-filled sac bursting with sweet juice with hints of tartness. They stay fresh for up to 2 weeks out in the open but when refrigerated, they can be safely stored for up to a month!

Persimmons are a delicate fruit that should be handled with care as the thin skin is delicate and bruises easily. A sweet persimmon contains twice the dietary fibre of an apple and higher levels of many minerals and antioxidants. Choose persimmons that are crisp and crunchy like an apple, surface blemishes are fine and do not affect the flavour and eating quality. Persimmons should be kept out of the fridge for up to five days and eaten fresh.

The guava has jade green skin, white crispy flesh, and a soft middle with seeds.

An unripe Guava can be kept at room temperature for 1-2 days to ripen, and refrigerated for up to 7 days once ripe. However, avoid keeping cut Guava in the refrigerator for more than 2 days. 

Guava should be washed and cut before eating, but leaving the seeds in is up to personal preference. Plum or liquorice powder go well with freshly cut Guava.

The sweet and juicy Golden Honey Mango is best for purchase when you can smell its fragrant aromatic sweet taste. Choose mangoes with bright yellow skin and a stem, as these mangoes will last longer. You'll want to keep this mango stored between 15 to 18 degrees, and enjoy them within 3 days. Look out for sugar spots, as these indicate that the mango is ready and has to be consumed.

Image courtesy of SOMMAI / FreeDigitalPhotos.net

When choosing a Conference Pear, look for fruits with more russeting on this skin. This rough, brown texture on the pear's skin is how people in Belgium choose the best fruit. To store this pear, keep it refrigerated between 1 and 3 degrees celcius to preserve the sweet, delicate taste and juiciness. It is normal for the white flesh to become more yellow as the pear ripens.  

Image courtesy of Mleprince

When choosing peaches, look for fruit that are firm to slightly soft to the touch. The background color should be a creamy white, with no hint of green. While some varieties have a red blush, this is not a true sign of quality. Slight brown spots are sugar spots to show high sugar level.

At home, be sure to keep peaches refrigerated at all times. Firmer peaches will keep up to 5 days, but slightly soft peaches should be consumed within 2 to 3 days.

The Brazilian Honeydew is characterised by its yellow wrinkled skin, and sweet and juicy white flesh. To choose the best honeydew, look for fruit that are firm with slight softness at the head region. The softer the fruit, the more ripe it is. Unlike other fruit, there would not be any smell to indicate the sweetness of a honeydew. 

Unripe honeydew can be kept at room temperature for 2-4 days or till ripe, and ripe fruit can be refrigerated for up to 5 days. Don't keep cut honeydew refrigerated for more than 3 days.

When choosing a nectarine, look for fruit with smooth skin that yield slightly to pressure. A good nectarine should smell sweet, but don't worry too much about looks as the colour of the flesh does not influence the texture or taste. Some varieties have small brown sugar patches on the skin that indicate sweetness.

Store nectarines in a plastic bag for up to a week in the coldest part of your refrigerator. To accelerate ripening, you can place nectarines in a paper bag at room temperature. Be sure to refrigerate and use these fruit within two or three days.

message: The Musk Melon has light yellow, net-covered skin, and orange flesh. When choosing a melon, look for fruit with a rougher surface covered by dense net. Don't worry about scarring on the skin, as fruit with scars are often riper and sweeter. Refrigerate whole ripe Musk Melon for  2-3 days, but keep cut fruit refrigerated for no more than 1 day.

The Turkish Sugar Apricot is highly regarded due to it's crunchy flesh and amazing deliciousness. The fruit is said to be 3 times sweeter tasting than watermelon or grapes! 

This fruit tends to be smaller than other apricots, but is packed with vitamins and nutrients that makes it an excellent choice. Look for fruit that are firm to slightly soft to the touch, and don't worry about a green-yellowish look or small red blemishes on the cheeks as these are normal and do not affect quality.

Sugar apricots may be ripened on the kitchen counter for 2-3 days, and stored in sealed contained in the fridge for up to one week. Ripe fruit should be consumed immediately.

Credit: www.Sugarapricot.com

The Lychee is characterized by its red skin, white flesh & black seed. Look for fruit that are still red, or only slightly brown in color. Slight browning, or light scarring does not affect the quality of the fruit inside.

It is recommended that you consume this fruit immediately as Lychee turn brown quickly. At most, keep lychee for up to 3 days in refrigerator between 2-5 degrees Celsius after purchase.

<U+00A9> Armonn | Dreamstime Stock Photos & Stock Free Images

When choosing cherries, look for fruit that have firm and glossy skin without blemishes. Darker skin and bright green stems are signs of higher quality cherries.

You can keep cherries at room temperature for up to 2 days. Remember to wash and dry the cherries so that they are ready for immediate consumption. 

If you need to keep the cherries longer, you can refrigerate them for 3 - 5 days. A large volume of cherries should be separated into smaller bags to prevent bruising. You can also keep cherries in the freezer if you wish to store them longer.

<U+00A9> Karcich | Dreamstime Stock Photos & Stock Free Images

You may like to read our Public Advisory on fraudulent emails here: http://bit.ly/fpfraudemail13.

When choosing bananas, consider their ripeness. Green, unripe bananas will keep well for longer than yellow, ripe bananas. Ripe fruit should be consumed within a few days. Don't forget to consume bananas before they turn more brown than yellow as this indicates that the fruit is over ripe. Avoid gray tinted or dull looking bananas as these have not ripened properly.

Bananas being kept at room temperature can be hung to prevent resting bruises. You may also like to keep bananas in the produce section of the refrigerator, but remember that they may speed up the ripening of other fruits.

Enjoy bananas throughout the day. This nutrient packed fruit is portable and delicious on bread, cereal, in smoothies, or eaten by itself!

<U+00A9> Alphacell | Dreamstime Stock Photos & Stock Free Images

The unique Turkish Altinbas Melon is typically available from June till September. This melon come with an excellent sweet taste, and it's distinctive golden skin with dark green stripes is hard to miss. In fact, the fruit's name is derived from the turkish word for gold (altin).

Be sure to consume the fruit within 1 week, and store the fruit between 3-6<U+00B0>C for optimal freshness.

Dear Fans,
With the current haze situation, we do urge our customers to take care of themselves and their families. Drink lots of water and use face mask whenever possible. To boost your body's protection against the pollution, it is recommended to have foods rich in Vitamin A as they help protect eyes, lungs and the oxygen carrying capabilities of the bloodstream. These include carrots, spinach, liver, mangoes and sweet potatoes.
Also, Vitamins C and E together help keep the lung tissue healthy!
So remember to eat fresh salads, raw vegetables and fruits and don't exert yourselves outdoors!

At FairPrice Xtra from this weekend onwards, shop for deals, play exciting games and stand to win exciting prizes!

The first event is happening at FairPrice Xtra Changi Business Park, Saturday, 22 June from 1pm till 4pm.

Minimum $30 spend to participate, see in store poster for more details.

The Turkish Cherry has a deep red colour and characteristic cherry heart-shaped.

Quality fruit will be clean, bright and shiny. The darker the color, the sweeter the cherry!

It is not recommended to keep cherries for more than 2 <U+2013> 4  days after purchase. If you are storing the fruit, they should be kept in an unwashed condition around 0~2<U+00B0>C. Separating large quantities of cherries into smaller bags can help to prevent bruising during storage.

Did you know that our recently opened FairPrice Finest at Zhong Shan Park is one of our most eco-friendly stores yet? 

We've setup an Eco Trail in store so that visitors can see many of the features that have led to the supermarket being awarded the Platinum BCA Green Mark Award.

FairPrice Finest at Zhong Shan Park is located at: 20 Ah Hood Road, #02-01 Zhong Shan Park (329984). Open 8am till 11pm daily.

In celebration of our 40th Anniversary, we're excited to offer several products in special edition packaging. You can get these special edition packs at FairPrice while stocks last!

Dear Fans, 
As a major grocery retailer, we recognise that you will still need to purchase your daily essentials in spite of the haze situation in Singapore. 
 
At the same time, we are also mindful of our employees<U+2019> health & safety and have put in place measures to protect them. All employees, including our trolley boys, delivery truck drivers, warehouse staff, and staff who are involved in outdoor activities have been provided with masks to use.  Measures are also in place to minimise strenuous outdoor activities for staff. Employees who have health concerns or feel unwell have been encouraged to speak to their supervisors to make alternative arrangements. 
 
We will continue to monitor the situation to ensure that appropriate measures are taken to protect our employees<U+2019> health and safety.
 
For more information, fans can contact our hotline at 6552 2722 or email us at general.feedback@fairprice.com.sg

The Hami Melon is sweet and crisp with a very high water content. The fruit is low in calories and sodium, and is a good source of dietary fiber and vitamins A and C. This melon also contains beneficial carotenes, indicated by the orange colored flesh.

A good quality melon should be heavy for its size, well shaped and give off a pleasant sweet aroma. They should not smell musky as this is a sign they are over ripe. 

Whole fruit should be stored between 0 - 2<U+00B0>C, while cut fruit should be eaten within 36 hours of preparation to avoid surface dehydration.
If you're staying indoors to escape the haze, you might like to try cooking one of the healthy recipes at WhatsUpAtFairPrice: http://www.whatsupatfairprice.com.sg/home/recipe

Are you looking for fun family bonding activities this school holiday? 

FairPrice Xtra is delighted to share with you exclusive recipes created by Food Guru Violet Oon in a cookbook. 
Enjoy some culinary fun together with your spouse or kids in the kitchen and cook yummy easy dishes in 5 steps or less. 

This cookbook comes free with every purchased copy of July issue of Simply Her magazine, available at newsstands now!

Dear Fans,

Face masks, including N95 face masks, have been restocked and are available at all 115 FairPrice supermarkets, FairPrice Finest and FairPrice Xtra hypermarkets from today onwards. The face masks are affordably priced to curb profiteering and to set benchmark prices.

Purchase of N95 masks is limited to 10 pieces per person to ensure as many households as possible are able to obtain masks for personal use. Additionally, purchase of 3-ply and 4-ply surgical face masks in 50-piece boxes will also be limited to one box per person. There will be no purchase limit imposed on surgical face masks in smaller packs.
We urge all customers to buy only what they need.

For more information, the public may contact FairPrice through its customer hotline at 6552 2722 or through email at general.feedback@fairprice.com.sg
Our recently opened store at Valley point is open from 8am till 10pm daily. We look forward to serving residents in the area!

Have you spotted these plastic tags on some of the fish at FairPrice Finest?

A local fish farm has collaborated with FairPrice to provide tagged fish for sale at FairPrice Finest. The tags are designed to provide you with information about where the fish is coming from, as well as link you to relevant recipes via the QR codes printed on these tags.

CandyCots are a delicious, sweet variety of apricot. The sweetest CandyCots, as measured by its Brix Level, are second only to dried dates. One key difference is that growers  pack the fruit in the field. This allows the fruit to be picked at higher maturity, when the fruit is sweeter.

Look for CandyCots that are starting to develop sugar spots, as these fruit are ideal for eating. The fruit should not have other blemishes, and should be a deep orange color.

Fruit that have started to develop sugar spots should be consumed within a day.Unripe fruit can be ripened in a paper bag with ethylene producing fruit such as bananas.

Follow the event at http://on.fb.me/12pg682

Raspberries make a healthy and tasty snack, or ingredient in your baking. This fruit is low in fat and high in fiber and vitamins, with a single cup providing half the daily recommended vitamin C.

Select plump, evenly colored berries with a slight gloss. The fruit should be free of dents and bruises, but the tiny hairs on them are completely natural and don<U+2019>t affect the taste of the berries.

Fresh raspberries should keep for one to two days in your refrigerator. Try to keep the berries dry, and consume them as soon as possible after purchase. It<U+2019>s necessary to gently rise berries before use.

Pluots are a sweet and juicy hybrid of plums and apricots
characterized by their red skin with yellow patches. The fruit's flesh is yellowish red in color, has a sweet, rich flavor and  firm texture.

When choosing Pluots, avoid fruits with heavy scarring, or those which are too soft or wrinkled. The fruit should be beginning to yield to gentle palm pressure, which indicates that it is nearing ripeness.

Pluots are best enjoyed fresh at their peak of ripeness. The fruit is ripe when it gives to gentle palm pressure and has increased fragrance. Place firm, unripe fruit in a paper bag or in a fruit bowl at room temperature and check daily. This fruit can be stored in the refrigerator for several days.

White Grapes should be an even light green color when ripe. Choose grapes that are plump, unblemished, and firmly attached to a flexible stem. Examine the stem end and avoid grapes that are wrinkled, brownish, or white at the connections.

Store grapes unwashed in a ventilated plastic bag in the refrigerator. Keeping the grapes dry during storage will make them last longer. They should last for about 1 week, although they are best within the first 3 days. As many grapes are treated with insecticide, they should always be washed just before serving.

Fancy a Vanilla Cappuccino? Here's a delicious recipe that you can easily make at home!

Ingredients:

Mitt<U+00E9> Vanilla Syrup (15ml)
Espesso (1 shot)
Fresh Milk (90-105ml)

Preparation:

1. Measure 15 ml of Mitt<U+00E9> Vanilla Syrup and add into an 8oz glass.
2. Add Espresso Shot into the glass filled with Mitt<U+00E9>. Stir to mix.
3. Steam milk at side of glass.
4. Scoop smooth milk foam to the top.
5. Dust the top of cup with small amount of cinnamon powder.

When choosing pineapple, look for fruit that is plump and fresh-looking. The leaves in the crown should be fresh and green, and the body of the pineapple firm. A ripe, fresh pineapple will have a sweet, pineapple like smell.

Fresh pineapple can bruise easily and will ferment if kept at room temperature for too long. If storing at room temperature, use within two days. You can extend the lifespan to three to five days by refrigerating the whole pineapple in a perforated plastic bag. 

Cut pineapple stored in an airtight container and refrigerated should be use within five to seven days. Let the fruit return to room temperature before eating to improve flavor. Cut pineapple can also be frozen in juice or syrup, but it will lose some flavor. To freeze, peel, core and cut the fruit into chunks. Place in airtight plastic bags or covered containers with natural juice and freeze up to 6 months.

Did you know: the buna shimeji and bunapi shimeji mushrooms cultivated by Hokto can be eaten without washing or rinsing as the growing and packaging process is fully automated!

The flesh of this mushroom is crisp in texture, providing a crunchy and juicy meat that may taste somewhat nutty or herb flavored when cooked. When storing, keep the mushrooms refrigerated and eat within 10 days of storage. When preparing, cut off the base of the cluster so each mushroom is individually cut at the stem.

It is a good mushroom to serve in stir-fried foods, with wild game or seafood, in soups or stews, and in a variety of sauces. When cooked alone, these mushrooms can be saut<U+00E9>ed using a higher temperature or slow roasted on a low temperature with a small amount of butter or cooking oil.

message:
When preparing food at home, remember this food safety tip:

Wash your hands thoroughly with warm soapy water before, during and after handling food to prevent bacteria from being transferred from your hands to food.
Thank you for journeying 40 years with us! Visit www.fairprice.com.sg/AR1213 for our FairPrice Annual Report 2012/13 where we show you the exciting highlights of the year!

Apricots are best when the season is peak. The two seasons for fresh apricots are short (approximately mid-May to July/August and November - January).

Consider the colour and firmness of the apricot when buying. Choose apricots that are firm to touch, plump in appearance and possess a deep orange or yellow/orange colour. A red tinge is also often present. Look for fruit that is unblemished, as apricots bruise easily. But don't panic i you do get a few bruised apricots as these are ideal for use in sauces or for moisture and flavor in baked goods.

Unripe fruit can be stored at room temperature in a paper bag until ripe. To store ripe apricots, place them in a sealed container and refrigerate them for up to one week. Remember to enjoy overripe fruit immediately, before they go mouldy or mushy.

An unclean kitchen can attract pests such as cockroaches that carry harmful bacteria. Keep your kitchen safe by cleaning all kitchen surfaces and counter-tops as well as all utensils with detergent and hot water. 

Cutting boards can also harbor bacteria. Wash cutting boards with detergent and hot water. Use a brush to scrub off food and dirt particles and sanitize plastic cutting boards with chlorine (bleach) solution.

Wash dishcloths or towels frequently in hot water and disinfect kitchen sponges in chlorine (bleach) solution to prevent bacterial growth.
Not sure what to cook for dinner? Excite your taste buds with this delicious recipe for Braised Sea Cucumber with Australian Baby Abalones:

Available at selected FairPrice outlets, Natur-a is a good source of protein, calcium, and vitamin D and comes in three delicious flavors: Unsweetened, Vanilla, and Chocolate. For those who do not consume dairy products, soy beverages are a good alternative source for essential nutrients.

Natur-a is a Product of Canada. Not from concentrate, No preservatives. No trans fat. Dairy free.

message:
Pacific West Tempura Fish Bite & Cod Fingers are available exclusively at FairPrice.
 
The Cod Fingers comprise good portions of real cod that are battered in a light, crispy crumb that fry or bake up to a delicious crisp. Similarly, the Tempura Fish Bites are made of white fish fillets battered in an airy Japanese-style tempura mix. Fried or baked, they don't leave that overly greasy sensation in the mouth and will please both the young and old.

Both are fantastic snacks and particularly easy to prepare when you have unexpected guests.

When choosing grapefruit, look for fruit that feel heavy for their size and is firm when applied gentle pressure. The interior flesh can range from pale yellow to ruby red. Red varieties have much higher levels of lycopene, an antioxidant.

Grapefruit will last up to 1 week at room temperature or 2 to 3 weeks refrigerated. Be sure to eat this tasty fruit before it goes soft or mouldy!

While grapefruit is a great source of vitamin C, potassium, and fibre, those taking certain medications (for high blood pressure, cholesterol, anxiety, to name a few) should beware, as grapefruit can interact dangerously with the drugs.

The Pairing Collection Salmon & Trout Bordeaux is one of this month's Just Wine Club featured wines!

Pale straw in complexion. The nose is very grapefruit, complete with a hint of green guavas. On the palate, the citrus fruitiness has an added aspect of limes. Fresh, crisp and spring-onion spicy. There's also a soft creaminess in texture on the finish. Very balanced. Medium bodied. Delicious as an aperitif and outstanding with deep-fried and steamed dim sums, finger foods, shellfish and fish including salmon, trout, tuna, mackerel and cod.

When you're handling fruit and vegetables at home, remember to rinse all fruits and vegetables thoroughly in a basin of tap water to remove any dirt, bacteria or chemical residues. Vegetables should be soaked in a basin of fresh tap water for 15 minutes, and you should rinse the vegetables once more in a basin of fresh tap water before cutting and cooking. Special detergents or washes for fruits and vegetables are not needed.

Visit http://www.whatsupatfairprice.com.sg/notes/Category/food-safety-tips for more food safety tips.

FairPrice has recently received customers' feedback about Facebook posts on free redemption of $100 FairPrice Gift vouchers. We are currently not running any such contest on Facebook and we advise customers to be wary of fraudulent websites and marketing campaigns.

For FairPrice organised contests involving monetary rewards, winners of these contests will be notified by post and we will also publish the results in a press advertisement. We do not inform contest winners via Facebook, email or phone.

Our customer database is kept confidential and is not shared with external parties.

FairPrice celebrates Earth Hour today by switching off non-essential lights at our stores from 8.30pm onwards this evening. 

As part of this global movement towards a sustainable future, here<U+2019>s what you can also do as your part to reduce your carbon footprint: 
 
1)      Use fewer plastic bags and bring your own bag
2)      Switch to LED lighting 
3)      Turn air-conditioning up by 1 degree Celsius 
4)      Take shorter showers

Have an unripe avocado at home? If you can't wait to savour it, try putting it in a paper bag with apples and bananas to hasten the ripening process! Ripe avocados can last for 1 to 2 days in refrigerator. 

Do take note that the fruit yields to pressure when gently squeezed with your palm. Also, avoid picking avocados with dark soft blemishes. Enjoy the nutty, rich flavour and the smooth creamy texture of this healthy fruit!

Always wondering on how to pick the best blueberries? Try looking for those that are firm, dry, plump and smooth-skinned with a silvery surface bloom! Avoid berries that are soft, mouldy, shrivelled or have decayed.

Dear Fans,

It has come to our attention of some accusations that we process halal and non-halal meats in the same machines. We would like to assure our customers that all our staff at the halal counters have been properly trained by a specialised halal consultant to handle halal products and there are dedicated sections for displaying halal meat.

The post we have seen is both insensitive and done in poor taste.  We seek your assistance not to recirculate this misinformation and inform your friends to avoid unnecessary confusion or offence that may result from it. 

For more information, please contact us at general.feedback@fairprice.com.sg. Thank you.

Sincerely,
FairPrice Management

The Lychee is characterized by its red skin, white flesh & black seed. Look for fruit that are still red, or only slightly brown in color. Slight browning, or light scarring does not affect the quality of the fruit inside.

It is recommended that you consume this fruit immediately as Lychee turn brown quickly. At most, keep lychee for up to 3 days in refrigerator between 2-5 degrees Celsius after purchase.

#fairprice #fairpricefinest
Weekends are the best time to relax at home and dig in to some delicious home cooked food! Tell us what 'soul food' you enjoyed this weekend, or share with us your pics if you took any!

We know what a chore it can be getting your kids to eat their veggies. Why not try introducing greens in a more fun way with some food art? It's a great way to spend time with them and show them that veggies aren't so bad after all!
Image credit: twohealthykitchens.com

Having the infamous 4pm office munchies but hate ruining your dinner? We suggest picking up a bag of our FairPrice edamame during your next grocery run! Highly nutritious, packed with dietary fibre easy to prepare - just cover the edamame in boiling water for 4 minutes and they're ready to pop!

People say that you can tell a lot about a person by what they put in their trolley. Tell us what your must-have items are in your trolley and what it says about you!

Basque Chicken is a tasteful combination of chicken, sweet peppers and tomatoes; usually accompanied with pilaf rice. Popular in the western Mediterranean region, it makes a hearty dinner for six. 

Why not try making it yourself with Fontignac cast-iron cookware this weekend? Check out the recipe here http://on.fb.me/1ux80Hs

Know how to tell if your eggs are fresh? Place the egg in a glass of water - if it sinks to bottom, it's still good to eat! But if it floats to the top, it's time to head back to FairPrice for a fresh batch of eggs!
Image credit: www.radacutlery.com
