Some say that breakfast is the most important meal of the day! Personally, we love starting a new day with a good cup of kopi, kaya toast and soft boiled eggs! What are your favorite Singaporean breakfasts?
Image credit: beirutibrit.wordpress.com

With the recent #Apple craze going on this week, why not go for the real deal instead? Available from tomorrow at our #FairPrice Finest stores, these Envy apples from New Zealand come fully charged with juicy goodness, packaged in a pretty gift box that you can share with your loved ones over the weekend!

Thanks to all the mothers that shared with us what #motherhood means to them, it was great getting to know our Singaporean mums and families! Congratulations to this week's winner, Lim Juyi! 

Check out our event photos here: http://on.fb.me/1BfFPAC. Don<U+2019>t forget to tag any familiar faces!

Don't forget to join our #ForMothers community for exclusive mothers-only content and contests: http://bit.ly/WErj5V.

If you love coffee as much as we do, then you'll know how a good cuppa never fails to perk you up , especially in the mornings! But how adventurous are you when it comes to trying new types of coffee, namely Durian coffee? Any takers?

Need your bananas to ripen quicker? Did you know that by placing them in a bag (plastic of paper) together with an uncut and unpeeled apple, pear or tomato speeds up the ripening process in as quick as 24 hours? Give it a try and let us know if it works for you too!

If you're looking for a little international flavour, swing by one of our Finest stores and spoil yourself at our Delicatessen! Sausages, cheese, meats, antipasto, you name it - it's the perfect way to treat yourself and your family after a hard day at the office!

Would you consider a bowl of instant noodles as comfort food? Dry, spicy or with soup, throw in a few slices of luncheon meat, and even crack an egg on top! What are you favourite instant noodles and how do you love to eat them?
Image credit: kaloriku.com

Did you know that Riesling is a great choice of wine to pair with asian cuisine, especially if it's on the spicy side, thanks to its higher fruit concentration and natural acidity? Pick up a bottle at any Finest store this evening and treat yourself to a relaxing night with your friends because we think you deserve it! 
Image credit: whiteonricecouple.com

Looking for an easy way to test the doneness of your steak without having to keep jabbing it? Check out this easy texture test that you can do with your hands so all your guests can get their steaks done just the way they like it, plus you'll look like a real pro!
Image credit: http://marxfood.com/

Here's something to wet your appetite for lunch! Traditionally known in Chinese cuisine for Kong Bak Pao, these FairPrice Lotus Leaf Buns could also be packed your filling of choice for the perfect snack!

Hate it when your broccoli comes out too mushy or too hard? Here's how to find that perfect balance when steaming your broccoli or any other vegetables! Cut them into uniform sizes and simply set a timer to avoid over-steaming it - Voil<U+00E1>!
Image Credit: http://www.taste.com.au/

Ever gotten your claws on a live hairy crab? Hairy crabs are now available at selected stores with fish beds at just UP$4.90 a piece - we suggest steaming them to savour their tender aromatic flesh and roe and then dipping the meat in minced ginger and black vinegar sauce! The size of these crabs may be small, but they're nevertheless so delicious! 
Image credit: www.lifeonnanchanglu.com

When it comes to preparing regular meals for your family, the reliability of your kitchenware is important. 

Fontignac<U+2019>s French enameled cast-iron cookware and ovenware is highly durable. Available in a vibrant blue, it does not discolour, and is built to resist rust as well as chipping. 
From now till 3 Dec, collect a bonus point with every $30 spent in a single receipt. With 16 points, you can redeem this ovenware for as low as $4.95!

For redemption details, please see in-store or visit: http://bit.ly/Y6Q37f

Here's something for all our great cooks out there to stay positive and to keep on whipping up one delicious meal after the other!

Who says that ice trays are just for making ice? Use them to freeze stock soup, tomato paste or even wine for next time! Easy to store, easy to reuse and a great cost saving idea!

Annoyed that your freshly cut apples/pears turn brown in just minutes? Try soaking them in cold lemon water to prevent browning. And hey, that's an extra dose of vitamin C in your diet! How else do you keep your fruit fresh? 
Image credit: http://organicconnectmag.com/

Preparing dinner tonight? Have you ever wondered how long is good enough to wash your vegetables rid of impurities? A 30-sec rinse, followed by a 15-min soak and a final rinse. TADA! Your vegetables are good to roll in your pots/bowls. Image credit: www.foodgirluk.com

Stop procrastinating and clean your microwave! The good news is, it isn't as tedious as you think! Place a handful of wet paper towels inside and run it on High for 3-5 minutes. The steam from the wet towels softens the grime. Once cooled, use them to wipe the oven's interior! It's almost too easy!
Image Credit: www.rd.com

Join us at Parenting from the Heart on 26 Oct 2014 for an informative and fun seminar on nutritional, physical and mental development for your tots. Learn how to raise Happy, Healthy, Gracious tots from doctors and experts from Thomson Medical Centre and other established organisations.

Why shouldn't you refreeze defrosted meat?

Meat quality reduces each time frozen meat is defrosted and refrozen. The ice crystals within the meat actually rupture the meat fibres. During thawing, there will be a loss in moisture and the meat will be very dry and may taste different. So plan ahead and plan your portions well!

Image Credit: http://metro.co.uk

Grab a bottle of Kaisi Milk Tea & Oolong Tea! Newly imported from Taiwan, these teas come with a unique taste that will quench your thirst.

KaiSi Milk Tea's milky taste and sweet aroma gets its strong flavor from Assam Tea.

KaiSi Oolong Tea undergoes a delicate brewing process with pure water that will have you coming back for more!

Get your hands on some today! Available exclusively at FairPrice.

If coffee/tea is your to-go morning perk me up, you'll probably have some brown stubborn stains in your cups even after washing them. Fret not! You can clean them out with equal parts of white vinegar and salt. Your cups will be rid of those stains!

Image credit: http://www.thekitchn.com/

We know how how much time you can waste by waiting around for your butter to soften before baking.  Here's an idea - grate your frozen butter and let it sit for a couple of minutes, the fluffy flakes will warm and soften right up so much quicker!

Image credit: http://www.thekitchn.com/

Mangoes are wonderful to eat, but messy to prepare! Fret not, we've got a brand new way to peel them without squishing the fruit! Hold your cut mango in one hand, and a drinking glass in another. Slide the glass rim underneath the mango skin and flesh. Give it a slight push and run the skin along the rim to remove as much flesh as possible! 

Try out this trick with avocados too!

Image credit: http://www.thekitchn.com/

Asparagus is a good source of vitamins and nutrients! Here's how to choose one:  A nice dark green/purple tinge on the tips of its spears are a good indication of quality! How do you serve your asparagus at home?

message: NTUC FairPrice joins the nation in mourning the loss of Singapore's first Prime Minister, Mr Lee Kuan Yew, whose vision and leadership have brought us to where we are. Mr Lee launched our first store in 1973 and his legacy will continue to live on in all our hearts. Our prayers and thoughts are with Mr Lee<U+2019>s family during this difficult time.

PRODUCT WITHDRAWAL
 
Dear customers, the products listed below have been withdrawn from our Finest stores due to mislabelling on its content. 
Customers who bought them may return it to the store of purchase for a refund. Please contact our customer hotline at 6552 2722 for assistance.
 
1.       Bee Int<U+2019>l Sports Ball Eggs
2.       Bee Int<U+2019>l Sea Quest Eggs
3.       Bee Int<U+2019>l Noah<U+2019>s Ark Egg

We apologise for any inconvenience caused.

#FairPriceWalks With U 2015 will be cancelled this Sunday, 29th March 2015, as a mark of respect for the passing of our Founding Prime Minister, Mr Lee Kuan Yew. All proceeds from participation fees from the event will be donated to charity. Participants need not return their goodie bags and T-shirt which have been distributed earlier. 
 
However, participants who wish to obtain a refund can contact (+65) 8452 5163 (calls only) during office hours from 9.30am to 6.30pm, Monday to Saturday (excluding Public Holidays). Or email walkswithu@fairprice.com.sg by Saturday, 4 April 2015, 12pm. More details: www.fairprice.com.sg/walk

Dear fans, we have received feedback about various sponsored Facebook posts offering a chance to win $1,000 shopping vouchers. Clicking the post would lead one to a survey link and after completing a few simple questions, one would be asked for personal information in order to <U+201C>claim the prize<U+201D>.

Some of these posts create a false impression that it is a FairPrice promotion by using without our permission, FairPrice's website address and our corporate logo. An example of such a Facebook post is shown below.

Such Facebook posts and surveys are neither created nor endorsed by FairPrice and we advise customers to be wary of fraudulent emails, websites and marketing campaigns. Our customer database is kept confidential and not shared with external parties

We will be reporting this matter to the police as well as Facebook. Please call our Customer Relations Hotline at 6552 2722 should you need any clarification.

Hi everyone,
 
A speculation about threadworms inside a can of Ayam brand Tuna at our store has been brought to our attention.
At FairPrice, we take these matters seriously. 
The manufacturer has investigated by checking the batch of products can by can in our stores and this is not true.
It is believed that the photo shows loose Tuna Flakes in the can, not threadworms.

Dear friends of FairPrice, 

FairPrice and Ayam Brand would like to assure consumers that canned tuna is safe for consumption after thorough inspection. We hope you can help spread the word around with your family and friends.

Full details below.

Making a cherry pie this weekend? We have a quick trick to pit your cherry with a small simple tool! Simply unfold a paper clip at its center, depending on the size of the cherry, insert either the large or small end of the clip through the top of the stemmed cherry. Loosen the pit, and pull its seed out. Do it the reverse way if you want to leave their stems intact. How else do you pit your cherries?

Image credit: http://eatingrichly.com/

Dear friends, we assure you that FairPrice Baby Wipes (200 pcs) is safe for use. 

Concerns were raised on the use of benzyl alcohol, a commonly used preservative in wet wipes and cosmetics. The amount in the product is well below the permissible limit of 1% under the ASEAN Cosmetic Directive (ACD), which Singapore adheres to.

The term "alcohol-free" refers to products that do not contain ethyl alcohol and ethanol. FairPrice Baby Wipes do not contain these ingredients. 

This product has undergone stringent lab tests and passed the skin irritant test ISO 10993.10-2010 by SGS, a third party accredited lab.

For further enquiries, please contact general.feedback@fairprice.com.sg or our hotline 6552-2722.

Dear Fans, it has come to our attention regarding concerns surrounding FairPrice chicken abalone instant noodles. We take food safety very seriously and spare no effort in ensuring our products are safe. The noodle manufacturer we use is BRC Global Standard Food Safety System certified which has stringent safety and quality processes in place. This is the first time we have received feedback on this product and we are reaching out to the customer to find out more about her concerns. Thank you.
Our Self-Checkout counters in Seletar Mall now accept cash! We'll be rolling this upgraded system out in more stores next year <U+2013> which ones would you like to see it in?

Dear fans, we understand there have been some concerns where it was believed that our staff had made an offensive remark to a customer, calling her a "terrorist". We would like to clarify that we have since spoken with the customer who shared that the person in question wore a white T-shirt, apron and yellow cap. This does not match the description of our uniform, which staff are required to don at all times while on duty. We will continue to investigate the incident to identify this individual. We do not condone such behaviour from any of our staff.

Dear Fans, 
 
We understand that there might be concerns over the Mars Chocolate products supplied to our FairPrice outlets, with the recent recall by AVA Singapore for all SNICKERS<U+00AE>, MARS<U+00AE>, MILKY WAY<U+00AE> and CELEBRATIONS<U+00AE> candy manufactured by Mars Chocolate in the Netherlands. 
 
We completed our internal checks and would like to reassure the public that none of our stocks come from the affected source. Only products labelled Mars Netherlands and manufactured between Dec 5, 2015 and Jan 18, 2016 are affected by this recall. 
 
We wish to reaffirm that we adhere to strict quality standards and regulations on all our products. Thank you.
Exclusive Visions Cookware. Redeem yours at NTUC FairPrice now & save up to 70% off RRP. While stock last! http://goo.gl/2LbZSY
Big savings on healthy buys await!

Dear Fans
AVA has recalled 18 Evergreen Manuka Honey products due to additives. We carry only 2 of these products. If you have purchased :
Evergreen Manuka Honey MGO30+ 500G; or
Evergreen Manuka Honey MGO30+ 1KG from us,
please bring the product back to any of our stores (with/without receipt) to get a refund. You may like to refer to http://news.asiaone.com/news/singapore/ava-recalling-18-evergreen-life-manuka-honey-products for more info.

Dear Fans,
We would like to assure our customers that the Health Sciences Authority (HSA) has stated there is no conclusive evidence linking talcum powder with ovarian cancer. HSA has also stated that there have been no adverse reports relating to talc in cosmetic products in Singapore.

You may like to refer to this article for more information: http://www.straitstimes.com/singapore/health/possible-link-between-talcum-powder-and-ovarian-cancer-inconclusive-hsa

message: Hari Raya is about a month away. We<U+2019>ve got a line-up of activities so stay tuned to our Facebook page. Watch the video below to find out what we have in store for you.

Dear Customers,
 
FairPrice is aware of the recent online post of a pest found at our Kang Kar Mall store. The rat had already been caught on 28th May, before the video was posted. NEA has inspected our store yesterday and no rats were found. We will continue to work with various parties to investigate the source of the rat. Furthermore, the store has since disposed all products that may have been compromised by the rat and have sanitized the area thoroughly.
 
Please be assured that should any pest be found in our stores, we will get our pest control specialists to respond within 2 hours.
 
We will continue to step up our efforts to maintain a clean environment for our customers.

Danial is already preparing for Hari Raya. Which ingredients has he selected to cook his dishes? Find out in this video which he has also shared on his Instagram @danialashh. 

Keep a lookout for his video recipes and tips on our Facebook page. #FPRaya2016

This might look like a mundane job but Mr Wong Chiak Hong is not just pushing the trolleys, he<U+2019>s bringing back the <U+2018>lost sheep<U+2019> faithfully without any complaints under our relentless hot weather. 

But that<U+2019>s not all<U+2026> At times, he takes it a step further and helps customers push their trolleys to the nearby carpark and offloads their groceries.  

Has anyone at FairPrice extended similar help to you? Share with us and tag us at #FPBetterLives and #FacesOfFP.

FairPrice | Kang Kar Mall

Dear Customers, 
We understand that Mr <U+5B59><U+96E8><U+660E> (Sun Yu Ming) has since posted various comments on his Facebook page that suggests we have been negligent in managing the pest incident at our Kang Kar store. We have since identified Mr Sun as the delivery person for bread at our Kang Kar store, whom had been reported in the past for several occasions where he had short-changed the store by delivering less that what the store had ordered. The video he had posted was taken while he was replenishing stocks. Notwithstanding, we assure our customers that we continue to take proactive preventive measures to address the pest incident. Our investigations also show that the source of the pest did not originate from within store. 

We are puzzled as to why Mr Sun would feel that we are not taking the necessary action and preventive measures to address this matter considering the various efforts we have since taken and continue to take. 
 
We understand that he has continued to make inflammatory remarks, which questions our integrity, with the intention to mislead in his latest post. Should he persist in making such remarks, we will take necessary actions to protect our reputation.

Dear Customers, Thank you for the understanding and concerns over the pest incident at our Kang Kar Mall. Here<U+2019>s an update of our investigation and what we have been doing since:

1) The rat that entered our premise was caught on 28 May.
2) Products suspected to be contaminated have been thrown away and the area thoroughly cleaned.
3) New rat burrows were found outside the store and Pest Control specialist conducted immediate extermination treatment and covered them. 
4) Potential entries into the store were identified and blocked.
5) Various layers of rat traps have also been laid to further prevent entry.
6) Additional cleaning operations conducted. 
7) Together with our pest control specialist, we continue to work with NEA to monitor that the area beyond our store is also treated for pest. 

We assure our customers that no efforts will be spared to ensure a clean and a pest-free environment at our Kang Kar store.

Dear customers, we have received various feedback on an email that offers a chance to win FairPrice shopping vouchers by participating in an online survey. We would like to inform the public that such promotions are neither created or endorsed by FairPrice. We advise customers to be wary of fraudulent emails, websites and marketing campaigns. Our customer database is kept confidential and not shared with external parties.

Is the stench of burnt popcorn too much to bear? 

Get rid of the unwanted smell with these 3 simple steps recommended by Hafeez.
1. MIX 2-3 chopped lemons  and some cloves in a large microwave bowl filled with water. 
2. Turn the button and bring the mixture to a BOIL
3. STEAM for atleast 15 mins

Don<U+2019>t forget to <U+2018>air out<U+2019> the microwave for atleast 1 hour. #FPRaya2016 #KitchenHacks

For over 10 years, the Lee sisters have continued to serve with commitment in FairPrice. Even through difficult times, they do not let it get in their way.

At different timings of the day, FairPrice employees, Mr Andrew Ng (68 years old) and his wife, Mdm Helen Tay (64 years old), embark on the same path to work. 

With Mdm Tay working on a permanent night shift and Mr Ng working on rotational shifts during the day, the couple has limited chances to see each other at home. 

Despite these odds, it does not bring them further apart. 
As Mdm Tay works just a stone<U+2019>s throw away from their home at FairPrice Telok Blangah, her loving husband will occasionally, pop by the store to catch a glimpse of his wife at work. At times, he even plans a breakfast date with her after her shift ends.   

Being in their golden years, they do not long to retire as they love what they do and value the security and stability obtained from their job. 

Do you have any heartwarming stories of encounters in FairPrice which you would like to share? Tag us at #FacesOfFP and #FPBetterLives to let us know more. 

Andrew Ng Thit Kiong | FairPrice Chinatown Point 
Helen Tay Kim Mui | FairPrice Telok Blangah

Nothing better than a lunch appointment with his wife, Mdm Alice Goh, sends a smile across Mr William Lua<U+2019>s face.

Working as a part time cashier at FairPrice Khatib, Mdm Goh ends work by noon, just in time for a lunch date with her husband, who works as a full-time storekeeper at FairPrice Yishun Ring.

Being married for over 20 years, they started working in FairPrice during the early 2000s. It was then that Mr Lua introduced his wife to FairPrice. From then on, they do not regret their decision to work at the supermarket. 

When asked why they chose FairPrice, they readily mentioned their passion for the retail line and flexibility in working hours which enables them to manage their lives effectively.

Know of stories of any other family members working in FairPrice? Share with us at #FacesOfFP and #FPBetterLives. 

Alice Goh Ai Lay | FairPrice Khatib 
William Lua Boon Peow| FairPrice Yishun Ring

If you are a regular customer at FairPrice Serangoon North Avenue 1, you might just recognise who she is.

Auntie Ng Chin is well-loved for her friendly personality, and this cashier and retail assistant is often seen buzzing around the store. She understands the importance of teamwork and responsibility working in a small branch. That is why she takes initiative to ensure that shelves are always stocked by alerting her colleagues even whilst performing her cashiering duties. 

Have you met a staff like her before during your shopping experience? Tag us at #FPBetterLives and #FacesOfFP Instagram to let us know more.

Is your child is meeting the World Health Organisation<U+2019>s daily recommended DHA intake*? Check your DHA with Aptamil, which is exclusively available at FairPrice and stand a chance to WIN the grand prize of 1-year Aptamil<U+25CA> supply or 10 consolation prizes of $100 worth of FairPrice vouchers each. Simply submit your entries here to join the contest! http://goo.gl/azC7aB

*As compared to other Growing Up Formula in Singapore for daily recommended feed. FAO/World Health Organisation recommends daily DHA intake level of 10-12mg/kg body weight for children 12-24 months, 100-150mg DHA+EPA for children 2-4 years of age or 150-200mg DHA+EPA for children 4-6 years of age. Reference: FAO 2010. Fats and fatty acids in human nutrition. Report of an expert consultation. FAO Food and Nutrition Paper no.91. FAO: Rome.
<U+25CA>1 year supply of Aptamil will either be Aptamil Toddler Gold+ Stage 3 or Aptamil Junior Gold+ Stage4 only. Mix and Match is strictly not allowed.

FairPrice | Bishan Street 13

Dear fans, we understand there has been reports about a mislabelled product at our store. We would like to take the opportunity to thank Ms Wang for highlighting this incident to us, and we sincerely apologise for the error. Ensuring accurate product pricing is paramount in our ongoing efforts in fulfilling our service promise to our customers. We have investigated the matter and the findings have shown that our staff had attempted to scan the products in quick succession, which resulted in the weight discrepancy.

FairPrice takes this matter very seriously and have since taken appropriate measures to impress upon our staff the grave responsibility in ensuring accurate product price labelling and have instituted additional procedures to ensure this does not recur. Beyond this, we also have a policy in place where customer may exchange or refund products that have been inaccurately labelled.

FairPrice seeks to continually enhance its operations, improve productivity and sharpen its service and customer experience. Customers may reach us through our customer relations hotline 6552 2722 or email address at general.feedback@fairprice.com.sg to share their feedback on our products and services. Once again, we sincerely apologise for any inconvenience caused.

At FairPrice, we believe in developing our staff to their fullest potential through various trainings. We also stay committed to doing good by providing our staff with a wide variety of volunteering opportunities regularly <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0084>

DHA supports your baby's brain development. The body produces only small amounts of DHA on its own, so food like fatty-fish, seaweed and milk fortified with DHA are important.

Aptamil Toddler Gold+, available exclusively at FairPrice, provides 125mg DHA per 100g, which is the closest to helping your child meet the World Health Organisation<U+2019>s daily recommended DHA intake*? Check the amount of DHA in Aptamil now and stand a chance to WIN the grand prize of 1-year Aptamil<U+25CA> supply or 10 consolation prizes of $100 worth of FairPrice vouchers each. Simply submit your entries here to join the contest! http://goo.gl/2mdde4

*As compared to other Growing Up Formula in Singapore for daily recommended feed. FAO/World Health Organisation recommends daily DHA intake level of 10-12mg/kg body weight for children 12-24 months, 100-150mg DHA+EPA for children 2-4 years of age or 150-200mg DHA+EPA for children 4-6 years of age. Reference: FAO 2010. Fats and fatty acids in human nutrition. Report of an expert consultation. FAO Food and Nutrition Paper no.91. FAO: Rome.
<U+25CA>1 year supply of Aptamil will either be Aptamil Toddler Gold+ Stage 3 or Aptamil Junior Gold+ Stage4 only. Mix and Match is strictly not allowed.

With the Zika situation in Singapore under control, we are encouraged to see the community rally together to support those affected and prevent its spread at the height of the situation. We continue to assure customers that anti-mosquito products will remain available at our stores, and we thank you for purchasing only what you need so that everyone can have access to it.

Our customers can always count on us to provide in times of crises like this. We will always strive to ensure the availability of necessities while at the same time working hard to keep prices stable. As a homegrown retailer, we are privileged to be able to do our part for the community to make lives better for all :)

They say the best way to understand someone is to walk a mile their shoes. Mr Lin Guanwen, Alvin, a team leader at FairPrice Xtra does just that, both for his colleagues and his customers. Stroke is an emergency that can happen to anyone. We teamed up with Stroke Support Station Ltd to reach out to and educate the community on stroke symptoms. You can reduce stroke risk by cutting out unnecessary salt, sugar and fats in your diet, and exercising at least 30 minutes 5 days a week.

S3 Stroke Support Station Ltd was specially set up to assist stroke survivors and caregivers. Find out more at www.s3.org.sg.

Some of you may remember the Origami Uncle from one of our past videos but for those who do not, this is 68-year-old Thomas Lau Say Lian, one of FairPrice Finest<U+2019>s customer service ambassadors. At a retirement age, he finds joy in seeing the smiles on the customers<U+2019> faces and gladly continues to serve them with the best that he can give. 

He puts in extra effort to ensure a pleasant shopping experience, from striking conversations with customers, exchanging grocery tips, to mediating challenging situations. A unique service he started doing for children at the store, outside of his working hours, is to fold them origami!

See the Origami Uncle in action here: https://youtu.be/NqrD-9BdI_k

message:
Living, breathing and working in Tampines, Ms Fam Yoke Feng has been a cashier at the Tampines outlet for the past 2 years. The affable 23 year old goes out of her way, quite literally, to come out of her cashiering counter to help elderly lift items up to the counter.

Not only hardworking and responsible, Yoke Feng also does her best to serve her customers as she feels that, <U+201C>Being committed to what I do is my responsibility.<U+201D> Even though she cannot remember all her customers' names, she recognises their faces or voices. Sometimes they even come up and say Hi to her!

Know anyone with the same positive attitude? Let us know by tagging #FPBetterLives and #FacesOfFP.

Our parents have always been there, showering us with care and unconditional love, but how often do we express our gratitude to them? This Christmas, FairPrice Finest presents the making of cherished moments. Find out what happens when the roles are reversed.

We received truckloads of textbooks and have concluded the donation drive for the FairPrice Share-A-Textbook project! Thank you for your generosity and for taking the time to share your textbooks with the community. Sharing your books to be reused also help to save the environment.   

These precious textbooks will be available to the public on 11 December. Stay tuned for more details!

The Boys<U+2019> Brigade Share-a-Gift (BBSG) Project is back! For 29 years, this Project has brought cheer to the less fortunate by distributing groceries and fulfilling Christmas wishes.  

We return to support this initiative again by being the official collection partner for this Project. From now till 31st December, you can help by donating groceries at any of the Project<U+2019>s gift boxes island-wide. The 12 locations of the gift boxes can be found at www.bbshare.sg.

The ingredients to a good relationship are time, patience, and dedication. Watch how Jia Yang prepared his romantic surprise to show his appreciation. Who do you want to thank this Christmas? Tell us in the comments below.

Mr David Lim is never selfish when it comes to sharing seafood handling and cooking tips with his customers. Besides handling live seafood and maintaining the seafood section, David will usually find out about the dishes his customers have in mind and then go the extra mile to recommend the most suitable seafood to them.

Before David joined FairPrice, he has never dabbled in seafood handling previously, but accepted the challenge tasked to him as he believes in pushing new frontiers. 15 years since, the man is an expert at scaling, cutting and packing, and gets it done in a jiffy so customers do not have to wait long before they get their fresh seafood! 

Picked up any cooking tips from any of our FairPrice staff? Let us know by tagging #FPBetterLives and #FacesOfFP.

From now till 31st December, you too can share by donating pre-packed food hampers to this Project through our FairPrice online platform. We will, in turn, contribute $10 to the Project for every hamper you donate online at http://goo.gl/UMIdIS

These pre-loved books have been lovingly sorted by volunteers and are eager to find a new home this Sunday, 11 December, at our distribution centres. You can find the list of the distribution centres at  https://www.facebook.com/events/1810338795891002/

The 34th edition of FairPrice Share-A-Textbook has been a success! You donated over 400,000 pre-loved books and shared them with more than 20,000 beneficiaries. All this would not have been possible without the tireless efforts of our volunteers including young Yong Kai, who spent hours sorting and distributing the books. We salute every single one of our volunteers who took the time to give back to the community.

 

Thank you and we'll see you again next year for next year<U+2019>s edition of the FairPrice Share-A-Textbook!

A veteran at the cashier counter, Ms Mary Ang goes beyond the call of her cashiering duties to take down customer's details to update them when an out-of-stock item gets replenished. 

Described as a "service star" by her regular customers, Mary was encouraged to join the trade by her sister, and has never looked back since. As she felt that she was not very educated back then, she was unsure if she was capable of taking up the job. However, her first manager patiently guided and motivated her to take on the challenge. 22 years on, when asked how she feels, Mary enthuses that, <U+201C>I'm very happy with this job, and love it very much.<U+201D> 

It is through the love for the job that makes her who she is today.

Know any stars like Mary? Let us know by tagging #FPBetterLives and #FacesOfFP.

Empathy comes naturally to Mr Joelle Ke, the team leader of grocery department. Always keeping a lookout for his surroundings, he ensures that he is available to assist the older staff in stocking up the heavy goods, and also staff who looks up to him for help.

Outside work, he took up a first-aid course and currently volunteers to help out the elderly and the disabled at Singapore Cheshire Home. Joelle believes that these are the group of people who require more attention, and he translates the skills learnt from volunteering into his management of the store. He believes it<U+2019>s his job to ensure a safe environment for all, especially the elderly, to shop at. 

Has our FairPrice staff looked out for your welfare while shopping at FairPrice? Share with us and tag us #FPBetterLives and #FacesOfFP.

Formerly from the engineering sector, Mr Kelvin Tan took the plunge into retail and is now the team leader of the non-food department at FairPrice Senja Grand outlet. 

Starting out as a retail assistant, Kelvin believes that the experience helped him understand how things work on ground level, which helps in his decision-making process as the team leader. He believes that it is important to understand the full operations so as to assist both staff and customers efficiently. Kelvin also familiarises himself with the workings of the other departments, so he'll be of assistance to all customers.

Know anyone who switched track and worked their way up in FairPrice? Share them with us and tag us #FPBetterLives and #FacesOfFP. 

FairPrice | Senja Grand

Manning the tills since 1998, Ms Julie Lee is one of the longstanding faces rooted in the Bukit Panjang Plaza outlet.

The 2-storey outlet is especially busy on weekends as families do their grocery shopping, and Julie understands the importance of thinking on her feet to help customers out so as not to create a queue congestion. After 18 years, Julie is so familiar with the layout that she can name you where different items are placed, and have no qualms rushing to a colleague's help on L2 even when she's situated at L1.

IIf you've spotted Julie around while shopping at the Bukit Panjang outlet, don't be shy to show your thanks via a comment below!

FairPrice Finest | Bukit Panjang Plaza

<U+201C>Service line is simple, but it depends on how we handle the customers.<U+201D>

In the face of a long day, Ms Lee Siew Hua<U+2019>s ability to keep up her smile makes a world of difference to the customers she serves. She remembers a difficult customer who used to visit every morning, who was eventually melted down by her consistent effort to greeting him Good Morning daily, as she saw a positive change in his attitude.

Her meticulous and friendly nature has earned her respect amongst her colleagues, and believe us when we say there's nothing Siew Hua can't smile through <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0089>

Has Siew Hua ever made your day with a smile? Share your shopping experiences and comments with us <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0081> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice Xtra | Hougang 1

We're pleased to announce that we're renewing our volunteer commitment for 2017 and aim to achieve 5,000 volunteers hours from staff and 500 hours from the public! Our focus will be on needy seniors and calls on youths to participate in community efforts.

During the Lunar New Year period, our FairPrice senior management staff, together with staff volunteers and members of the public, celebrated the occasion with residents of Ren Ci Nursing Home. If you're looking for opportunities to volunteer, don't hesitate to drop us a note at http://heretomakelivesbetter.com.sg/volunteer <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+008A>
story: NTUC FairPrice feeling positive at Renci Nursing Home.

message:
Dealing with Mr Jimmy Per is just like dealing with the friendly butcher from your neighbourhood market. 

Equipped with a huge variety of knowledge amassed from 16 years with us, Jimmy is always set to provide his customers with the most valuable advice on how to handle their meat and poultry. Not only that, outside of work, he takes the initiative to research on different recipes and recommends them to his customers.

It is no wonder why Jimmy is the butcher that we all can trust. 

Been served by Jimmy before? Show your thanks by sharing a comment with him below <U+263A><U+FE0F>

FairPrice | Bedok North

As CNY draws to a close on the 15th day, here are some special deals we bring to help #StretchYourDollar. Enjoy savings on bird's nest, cod steak, chocolate, facial tissues, wine and more. Swing by our stores soon as promotion is limited to TODAY ONLY, so get yours in time <U+23F0>

We're committed to making lives better for the community and are pleased to announce that NTUC FairPrice Foundation is partnering the five Community Development Councils (CDCs) to launch a new $1.5 million milk fund scheme to benefit up to 7,500 children from low-income families.

The 5 CDCs will identify eligible families and distribute the milk fund vouchers accordingly, which can be used to purchase any brand of milk powder for children from all our supermarkets <ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BD><U+00BC>

PSA <U+26A0><U+FE0F>: We've noticed another scam survey circulating on Facebook in form an article link. 

The article titled <U+201C>The Death of Fair.Price in Singapore<U+201D> redirects users to a survey link on a "yamoja mobile" site. The scam site will prompt users to input their contact number after 2 questions. Please be wary that this quiz was neither created nor endorsed by us. We have since lodged a police report, and urge the public to share this information and be alert when it comes to fraudulent quiz sites.

The 49 year old cashier chose to work in FairPrice as she is a frequent shopper who grew up getting her grocery done with us. After expressing her interest to an ex-colleague, Geok Mui quickly came onboard and became an indispensable member of the West Coast Drive outlet with her cheerful and helpful attitude to help customers stretch their dollar.

Don't forget to leave Geok Mui an encouraging word if she's ever lent a pleasant shopping experience to you before <U+263A><U+FE0F> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

As the Chief Cashier at FairPrice Finest in the Changi Airport T3 outlet, Ms Neti Ibrahim usual duties are cashiering and ensuring sufficient cash float. Furthermore, she is well versed with the products the store carries. Because of that, she is able to provide product recommendation to tourists travelling out of Singapore. Her colleagues praise that she's responsible and professional, and is someone whom they rely on in times of need.

It's little heroes like Neti who keeps things smooth and running. Don't be shy to leave your thanks below if she's ever made your shopping experience pleasant <U+263A><U+FE0F> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

message: Fighting food waste is one of our ways to make the planet better. Besides the FairPrice Food Waste Framework that has reduced food wastage by 40 per cent over the past year, here are more interesting things you can try out to do your part to reduce food waste! <ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BD><U+009C><ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BD><U+009E><ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BD><U+0097>

A mother of 3, Ms Junainah Zainol enjoys working at FairPrice as it gives her the ability to spend time with her children. The customer-centric staff observed that while her regulars used to come with newspaper cuttings to buy products on promo, they now simply show her their mobile phones. Receptive to changes, Junainah has since gotten on Facebook to catch up with the times!
  
Wanna share your thanks for Junainah? Send it right to us below <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B1><U+0087><ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BF><U+00BC> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

story: NTUC FairPrice with Ofelia S. Palisan.

message:
At the tender age of 18, Ng Jie Sheng is already a permanent part timer with us at Jurong Point's FairPrice Xtra. Earnest and open to learn, Jie Sheng plays the role of a cashier roller, a unique position which is only found in bigger stores. He juggles between returning unwanted items to shelves, collecting baskets, checking prices, and answering cashier bells.

 At work, he has the philosophy <U+2013><U+201C><U+8FB9><U+505A><U+8FB9><U+5B66><U+FF0C><U+4E0D><U+61C2><U+5C31><U+95EE><U+4E0D><U+61C2><U+5C31><U+5B66><U+201D>. This means that he learns on the go, and he asks questions to learn whenever in doubt. Send a smile to Jie Sheng's face by sharing a word of thanks below <U+263A><U+FE0F> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice Xtra | Jurong Point

Dear shoppers,

We have received feedback on a recent social media post regarding a quail egg product sold at our Jurong outlet. Rest assured that FairPrice takes food quality and safety very seriously and we have been investigating this matter with our suppliers and the authorities. 

If you spot any issues with our products, please approach our staff immediately if you're in store, or alert us via our customer service hotline at 6552 2722. This would help us greatly in addressing the issue at once. Thank you.

As a firm advocate for active living and senior employment, we're proud to support the Centre for Seniors' (CFS) vision of fostering a positive active mind-set in seniors by engaging them in both the workplace and community.

At FairPrice, we recognise the wealth of experience, skills and wisdom seniors bring to the workplace. Just last year, we provided re-employment contracts to some 1,200 staff who reached the re-employment age of 62! Together we can make lives better for all <U+263A><U+FE0F>

Our stores will be a little dimmer than usual today<ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B2><U+00A1> That<U+2019>s because we<U+2019>re switching off non-essential lights for Earth Hour starting from 8:30pm onwards! 

Join us in this energy-saving gesture for our planet during Earth Hour and beyond. Check out heretomakelivesbetter.com.sg for our other green initiatives.

Think you know the snack aisle well? TheSmartLocal.com is gonna make you think otherwise! If you're ready to stray away from your usuals, these exclusively-imported goodies are worth a shot <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B1><U+0087><ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BF><U+00BC>

PSA <U+26A0>: Dear shoppers, there is another voucher scam offering $300 FairPrice gift vouchers by spending $100 at FairPrice stores. Please be warned that this was not created nor endorsed by us, and we advise all shoppers to ignore and avoid sharing this illegitimate claim.

Please contact our customer hotline at 6552 2722 during office hours or drop us a PM to verify online promotions. 

Thank you!

We're working towards less plastic waste by encouraging more shoppers to bring their own bags when visiting our stores!

We saved 10.9 million plastic bags with our Bring Your Own Bag initiative last year, and we extend the invite to you to make the planet better for all too.

To find out more about how we're going green for a better planet, head on to http://po.st/bfop

Stationed in the frozen, grocery and back store department, Mr Lee Choon Seng helps to order, receive and replenish all the goods you see on our shelves. Choon Seng's journey with us spans a whopping 32 years and at 62, he enthuses that he wishes to continue working for as long as he is able to.

Has Choon Seng ever lent you a helping hand? Leave a word of thanks to make his day! #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice | Clementi B

Taste Australia's fresh native produce such as milk, cheese and wine right here at FairPrice from now till 5 Apr <ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00B7><U+00A6><ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00B7><U+00BA> To make the deal sweeter, stand to win S$3,000 worth of FairPrice gift vouchers* with any participating products purchased, once you register your name into our e-Lucky Draw Portal at fairprice.com.sg/luckydraw <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+008A>
*T&Cs apply. Please see in-store poster or approach our friendly staff for more details.
You<U+2019>ll not find these products anywhere else! Exclusively imported by FairPrice, don<U+2019>t hold back when it comes to stocking up these goodies <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+008B>

You may not have seen Ms Carol Chin in-store, but you'd have heard her voice as she sorts out your query. As an admin assistant at the Bedok North branch, she usually answers to stock enquiries over the phone. Amongst the most interesting experience was a customer who once ordered 6 cartons of roti prata to be packed to send over to a friend in Europe. Her dedication towards this job helps smoothen and coordinate the operations of the store.

Has Carol ever helped you out with a query? Leave your word of thanks here to make her day! <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+008A> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice | Bedok North

Did you know that FairPrice stocks over 50 types of seafood certified as sustainable by the Marine Stewardship Council (MSC), Aquaculture Stewardship Council (ASC) and Friends of the Sea at our stores? Buying seafood that comes from sustainable sources helps ensure the long term vitality of the harvested species, the oceans, and the livelihoods of fishery-dependent communities <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B0><U+009F>

So the next time you shop, look out for seafood with these labels and do your part for the environment!

Even though some fruits may be blemished on the outside, they're still tasty on the inside. Give 'em a chance the next time you're grocery shopping, and support our "Great Taste Less Waste" project to reduce food waste together <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+008A><ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BD><U+0085>

To find out more about FairPrice's contribution for a better planet and how you can do your part, visit http://po.st/bfop <ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BC><U+008F>

Be in the pink at FairPrice Xtra<U+2019>s Health & Wellness Fair happening from now till 26 April with hale & hearty deals. Pssst...receive a free apple from us during the weekend <ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BD><U+008E>

Check out Low GI, Organic Choices and more at our FairPrice Xtra stores now!

You can be sure to head to Ms Yong Choon Kin for recommendation, as she loves providing her personal recommendations to shoppers at the Bukit Batok East branch. On top of that, she believes that it's important for customers to be able to find what they wish when they come into the store. If the particular product goes out of stock, she will recommend alternatives to customers.

Ever bought an item Choon Kin recommended? Share with her how you felt about it below! <U+263A><U+FE0F> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice | Blk 280 Bukit Batok East

Low sodium, reduced sugar, whole grain, organic and low GI<U+2013>there're plenty of healthy options and fun awaiting at FairPrice Xtra<U+2019>s Health & Wellness Fair from now till 26 April. 

Spin & win with every $30 spent in one receipt*. Shoppers who swing by our stores between 12-4pm on weekends will receive a free apple each <ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BD><U+008E> See you there! 

*T&Cs apply. Check in store for more details.

message:
While making his rounds in the store, Mr Bryan Tan, department manager at FairPrice Xtra Nex Mall ensures a pleasant shopping experience for his customers. Being attentive to details, he noticed that queues at cashier counters are always long during peak hours. Bryan responded to this situation and activated additional packers at the counters to shorten the waiting time.

If you're a regular shopper at FairPrice Xtra NEX mall, give a shoutout of thanks to Bryan in the comments below <U+263A><U+FE0F> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice Xtra | NEX Mall

Be Scam-Smart! Many scams involving false surveys awarding FairPrice vouchers have been spotted. These are neither created nor endorsed by us. We take the matter very seriously and have lodged police reports. We've compiled a list of the existing scams here: https://www.facebook.com/notes/ntuc-fairprice/be-scam-smart/10155160404244618/

What we can all do is to be Scam-Smart with these 4 steps! Tap in to see how you can prevent your friends and loved ones from falling into the trap <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B4><U+008D>

Psst...stay tuned for some great news and deals coming your way! <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0089>

Ever wondered what happens to the unsold yet wholesome food at FairPrice? Hint: they end up in good homes. <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+008A>
  

Together with non-profit organisation Food from the Heart, our volunteers help to pack donated food items which are then distributed to families in need. For more information about other initiatives in reducing food wastage, visit: po.st/09LAZG.

With 20+ years of experience in seafood and 30+ years as a butcher, Mr Jimmy Ong is currently the team leader of the frozen food/seafood department at FairPrice Finest Thomson Plaza.

As the "superman" of the department, Jimmy takes stocks, orders, cleans the fridge, and is able to help out even at the vegetable department when they're shorthanded. Despite this, his first love is still in butchering, and helps out passionately with all knowledge at his fingertips.

Ever met the meat man? Convey your thanks in the comment section below <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B8><U+0081> #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice Finest | Thomson Plaza

We asked you to share with us some of your Kirkland Signature favourites last week and you've spoken! Kirkland Signature's Extra Fancy Mixed Nuts gets two thumbs up. <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B1><U+008D> <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B1><U+008D>  

Tuck into this and other USA Top Picks at Warehouse Club this May!

Behind every successful champion is a dedicated mother. Support the champions from Special Olympics Singapore as they pursue their athletic dreams and the brands that celebrate the #championsbehindchampions now at all FairPrice stores. 

Exciting goodies await!

Food waste is an important issue and for the past two years, we managed to save 920 tonnes of food from going to waste through our FairPrice Food Waste Framework.

We can, of course do better, and we<U+2019>d like to hear from you. Share with us in the comments on how you think we can reduce food waste further!

More information on the FairPrice Food Waste Framework can be found at po.st/bfop
Now that you know to drink, decant, pour and store your wine, learn a tip or two from sommelier Gerald Lu about wine etiquette! <ed><U+00A0><U+00BC><ed><U+00BD><U+00B7>

She goes the extra mile by calling a customer when an item is in stock. She helps out her colleagues from other departments who are not fluent in English. She may be small and petite but she takes on physical tasks as exercise. Every day, she brings a positive attitude to work. That's Ms Evelyn Palsario Matillano for you.

Frequent the Hillion Mall outlet? Say "hi" in the comments below! #FacesOfFFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice | Hillion Mall

Dear fans, we understand a video on a chin chow product is being circulated. Thank you for bringing this to our attention. We take food and safety matters very seriously and we have since been in contact with our supplier for the product in question. We would like to appeal to the creator of the video to contact us directly through private message, email: general.feedback@fairprice.com.sg or through our hotline at 6552 2722 to aid in our investigation. Thank you!
To the ones who've loved, clothed, fed and nurtured us to be better people, Happy Mother's Day! FairPrice wishes all moms a day as special as you are <ed><U+00A0><U+00BD><ed><U+00B2><U+0090>

UPDATES: We have contacted the manufacturer, Tan Soon Mui, for clarification regarding the allegation that their chin chow (grass jelly) product is made of plastic. It has been clarified that this claim is false, and we understand that the manufacturer has made a police report over the post. Checks on existing batches do not reveal any abnormalities and samples have been sent for further lab tests as well. The manufacturer has advised that freezing and thawing of the product may affect the texture and consistency of the product. 

Nonetheless, we had appealed for the creator of the video to contact us to aid in our investigations and to attain an actual sample of the product in question. We have yet to establish a connection with this customer. We advise the public not to circulate unfounded or unverified information which may cause unnecessary public alarm, and the manufacturer is currently working with the authorities on the matter.

We<U+2019>d like to take the opportunity to also remind the public to be mindful of information spread on social media and messaging platforms, and encourage all to verify information directly with the source when in doubt. For clarifications, consumers may contact us directly at our Customer Relations Hotline at 6552 2722, through email at general.feedback@fairprice.com.sg or post a comment on our Facebook Page at www.facebook.com/thatsmyfairprice/. Thank you!

13 years at FairPrice has taught Ms May Lim Kah Keow that there is always joy in helping others. Although as a cashier, she still went out of her way to help a customer retrieve less accessible products. To May, she sees it as <U+4E3E><U+624B><U+4E4B><U+52B3> (no trouble at all). The familiar faces at her line attest to the bonds she has fostered over her long years of selfless service.

Are you one of those familiar faces? Give her shoutout in the comments below! #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives

FairPrice Finest | Bukit Panjang Plaza
story: NTUC FairPrice with Today up Feed.

message:
FairPrice continues to make lives better for the community. This morning, we announced the brand new FairMily Kit, available for all Singaporean new-borns over the next 3 years. Worth $100 each, it contains essentials for every new family. Check it out at www.ntucgoodstart.sg

We'll also be continuing our support towards the Food Voucher Scheme, putting in $1.2 million, which will help 20,000 low-income households. Find out more about all our giving back initiatives here: http://heretomakelivesbetter.com.sg/giving-back-for-the-better#donations

When it comes to effective in-store display and placements, Mr Jack Pei is the man to go to. Prior to his current role as the team leader of the Fruits & Vegetable section, Jack was a visual merchandiser in FairPrice where the in store collateral display and placement you saw were a part of his handiwork! 
 
When given the opportunity to attend training courses at FairPrice Training Institute (FPTI) and Lifelong Learning Institute, Jack took up the challenge as he was happy to be able to develop his potential by trying out new responsibilities within the company. 
 
Seen Jack busying around the FairPrice Xtra in Jurong Point? Show your appreciation in the comment section below! #FacesOfFP #FPbetterlives
 
FairPrice Xtra | Jurong Point

Thank you for all the support you've shown us! We've improved on our performance in the latest Singapore's Top 100 brands; achieving 3rd place, up from 5th last year. The improved ranking is a testimony of FairPrice's dedication to serving the customers, and also our commitment towards our social mission. 

The findings is presented by Campaign Asia-Pacific and based on consumer attitudes in 13 markets from Australia to Asia. We're glad to have everyone with us all this while, and will continue striving to make lives better for all <U+263A><U+FE0F>
